text: Good times here... Cheap booze and good atmosphere. Reminds me of some of the better bars back East.

My husband and I were looking for a cool spot to watch the games and some place that had some good food while we watched. This place hands down great across the board 
Great food breakfast burrito on point the service was on point the waitresses held it down. Will def Coke here again for football season when back in Vegas
Great bar and ambience.  Went out of their way to get my game on SEC network when they didn't even have a subscription to the channel. We will definitely be back!
I love this bar grate food and good layout much better service now and Sunday's are fun with all the games on!!
Best Bar Food!  Friendly bartenders!  It's a new regular hot spot.  Just opened in August 2014.  52 Craft Beers.  Darts pool table this place really has it all!

I had a blast here the other night played darts with my friends. Drank some really good Joseph  James  Citra Rye Ale  got a free glass! Started getting hungry and I ordered the burger oh man oh man it was so juicy . I have never had a burger like it in my life.

Super impressed!!! Came to watch the football game...great food, drinks, comfy couches and Carla was the best!! Everyone was extremely friendly, checked on us but weren't overbearing. Would definitely come back.

Love that this bar is close to my hood. Beer selection excellent. Kat the server - we love her, extremely up on her beer smarticles. Don't care for the beer prices not being listed on menu. I like to know how much I am paying. Food has been hit and miss. 9/13/14 beer prices were now on the menu.
I loveee this bar and the bartender Dai is AMAZING !!! She's the best!! I would deff recommend this bar.

I haven't tried the food here so my review is strictly on the beer and atmosphere...WOW! This is a super chill and a great place to come with friends and relax with a few SUPER low priced beers and dozens of LCD TVs. The staff are nice and the patrons are there to have fun. 
I haven't tried the food but saw a lot of people eating some good looking burgers. Will have to try next time I head to Rebel Republic, which will be very soon. 
Keep up the good work!

Great little bar. Best and most beers on tap in Vegas.  Last visit was not so great, but Tina and Larry were the best.  Do yourself a favor and stop in for a beer and some snacks. 

Tina was quick to say hello and offer many beer suggestions based on my preference. Found a few to try. Larry provides great conversation and knows how to mix some specials. Just ask him for his favorite. He will hook you up.

Pros: Very good burgers, especially the Asian turkey burger, also awesome selection of beer. Constantly changing beer list is also a plus.
Cons: Really slow service, smells like Arizona Charlie's inside. Used to come here a lot but it got to the point where it wasn't even worth the wait on a slow day.
I love this bar especially Larry the bartender.  I just wish the food was more consistent. My friends won't come here with me anymore because the food is always different.

Came here from California while visiting Vegas. Enjoyed the atmosphere. The food was very tasty and of course they had great drink specials. $2 fireball shots. This was during Sunday Football and the crowd was all into it like we were. I would give them 5 stars , but the pool table was broken and wouldn't roll the white ball down to the slot. We had to ask for assistance about 5 times throughout 2 games of pool. Still enjoyed it there !

Went in for a quick lunch, had their roast beef sandwich paired with a Firestone IPA, great food and service.  They were actually having some plumbing problems while I was ther, but the bartender Valerie made sure everyone new that they did have facilities in the back for the patronage.  Have to say a very good experience and a friendly attentive staff.

I love this place!!! Phenomenal beers you can't go wrong....bartenders are very knowledgeable on what they serve....come in and larry or phil will take great care of you if your new to the craft beer scene or seasoned veteran...the BEST bar in vegas ive been to in 12 years....you gotta check it out!!!!!

Awesome place!  Brand new bar at Sahara and Valley View near CVS and Office Depot.

All of the bartenders, the servers, and the manager are friendly people.  They have a huge selection of craft beers on tap plus all of the usual liquor.

The food is among the best you will find in Vegas and the prices are great also.  Tonight I had the pastrami egg rolls which were unbelievably delicious, and a cheeseburger which I loved also.

Check this place out, you will not be disappointed!

My favorite place to have a beer and dinner and watch a game so far in Vegas. They make all of their food fresh and from scratch and you can tell. No frozen burgers or anything. Kobe sliders, Eastwood burger, and some new style of egg roll were all top of the line. And a huuuge selection of craft beer.

A great place for dinner and beers after work. The beer menu is one of the most extensive selections I've seen in Vegas and is constantly changing. Gotta love the local Rebel support too. After a couple visits, I decided to join the Beer Club and it was a great idea. A free beer every week. And that's not the best part...they even provide you with a personalized stein!

The food is elevated bar food, definitely better than I would have expected. When busy the atmosphere is cool, but I've been there when it's dead too. Glad to have a neighborhood bar like this near my place of work.

Place is a-ok.

Staff is friendly and knowledgable. With so many craft beers to choose from, every visit will be an adventure.  Smoking allowed but didn't smell smokey. 

With regard to the food it is a few dollars too much for what you get. $9 for 5 chicken wings? The conventional standards for bar food is tossed out the window. One is that the food is cheap and plentiful. Rebel Republic is expensive and small.  The other convention is that the food is average. Not here.

The food is fantastic!

I would highly recommend Rebel Republic for food with a warning about the cost.   

Beer prices were fair.  So we'll be back.  We will most definitely look for specials cause with so many choices in Las Vegas, we often have to go to options that offer a more modest value.

Been here several times it is  becoming my spot after work. Larry is very knowledge about beer and has figured out my taste and offers great choices. The wings and egg rolls are delicious great presentation and portions. The atmosphere is comfortable and relaxing. I will continue to stop by after a long night at work for great service food and cold beer.

This place is Amazing for football Sundays. The staff is super accommodating and will put your game on whatever TV you would like.  Tons of beer to choose from including great New Belgium Beer specials during game day. My new favorite Football Sunday destination!

3 stars for rebel republic.
We came during the Patriots opener to find a somewhat dead bar. Although it's a new bar, the atmosphere was slow and boring. We had to request to have the tvs changed and volume turned on. The food and beer selection was awesome, and was at happy hour prices. Buttttt the server was pretty subpar. Working in the industry, I'm not one to really nitpick but I do notice the small things typical customers may miss. Our bartender Tina M was extremely slow and pretty unfriendly. I understand to a certain extent if they were busy, but with a dozen customers split between two bartenders, there's no excuses. Overall it's a nice venue with lots of potential, but it certainly needs some fine tuning when it comes to customer service. I will be back to give another chance, and am hoping for a better result!

Rebel Republic is the best!!! Great beer, great food, and great bartenders. 
Best burgers in town, I think. The Ruben egg rolls are awesome. And when it's happy hour they are only $5. How sweet is that. With 52 beers on tap you get to try so many new kinds of beer that other places in Vegas don't provide. Who won't love that. This girl does. I'll keeping telling everyone they have to go to Rebel Republic!!!!
Love rebel republic! Sweet spot with great food, not your typical "bar food" and craft cocktails. Games, craft drinks, awesome bartender.(Larry)! A wide selection of beer!!
Steven is the best!!! Knowledgable bartender, Great service when he's working. Great beer selection! Great turkey club.

Love this place. Love the blonde GM Tina! And she's also very easy on the eye..Hubbahubba lol.. Talk about going over and beyond! I see her catering to everyone's needs! Especially the beer geeks who go in there and throw a tantrum because their fav beer isn't on the line! Here's a hint... Go and buy it in a store and take it home and complain about not having cool bartenders and customers to hang out with, she def deserves the praise for bringing in cool and great beers. The rest of the team is pretty cool too. Very happy to go in there and chill, eat some food and drink some great beers. Tina! You rock!! Def coming back! Thanks for always making us feel at home in here!
Awesome place to dine and have drinks!  Price was amazing! We will definitely eat there again when we are in Vegas!! Oh! And excellent friendly & helpful bartender. Her name is Amy!!!

Vegas has no shortage of bars and sports bars. Rebel Republic stands out because it's not a chain and the employees really know their beers. They have one of the best rotating selections of beer in the city on draft , plus plenty of bottles. If you are lucky, you'll have Sachi as your bartender.  As smart as she is funny, Sachi will introduce you to new beers, learn your name, and remember you on your subsequent visits. 

Try their avocado tempura or jalapeno poppers.  Their food, including the fries, are made on premises and quite possibly the best bar food you're going to find on the west side.

I absolutely LOVE all the Bartenders here, The atmosphere is great also but the owner must be new at this. Every time I come in here and he is there, he treats me awful, it just seems like there is always a problem, he stares, isn't very friendly and has asked me to move machines while gambling for "higher" rollers. The comps used to be very good but the last few times I have come it really hasn't been worth it. Like I said, ALL of the bartenders here are AWESOME, fun and they make me want to stay. The food is amazing and the cooks are all very friendly and attentive. The only reason why I gave this place a low rating is the owner and I really don't like the mixed theme of hip joint and sports bar. I don't come to a bar to watch sports, I come to drink and gamble.

With thousands of bars in Vegas I drive 20 minutes to the Rebel best happy hour specials great food (wings are a must try) Sachi is my bartender shes the best I go there once a week sometimes twice great atmosphere great beer great food definitely recomend. You should become a regular!!!!
Great beer, great food, great service and a great atmosphere. Bartenders are friendly and courteous.  Fries are fresh cut and simply delicious! Got to check this place out.

We stopped by for Sunday burgers and my husband wanted PBR on tap ( no sampling of the 52 other beers but note they also have 2 NA beers). We had 10 TVs in our sight, great server, delicious food and plenty to drink!  The calamari was tender inside a flavorful breading and the seaweed was a terrific complement.  One juicy burger, one pork tenderloin that was a crispy crust around a thick cutlet, and yummy fries.  We will be back !!

I had to update this one last time, due 100% on personnel! Kat is the best! She's the most knowledgeable beer babe I have encountered in Vegas this far! Truly a delight! And know that if either her or Larry are behind the bar, you're sure to enjoy your visit. Definitely let her recommend her faves, she won't steer you in the wrong direction :)

This is my favorite place to
Hang. Great food. Craft brews. Pool and darts. Jukebox. Gaming. Lots of tvs for sports! Football
Season!!! The best bartenders.... Melissa, Tina, Steven, Larry, Sachi!!!!! Great service- always with a smile! You should be here! Now!

I went with three stars, but I am in between three and four. We ordered the southwest eggs rolls, a pretzel, monster burger, and the reuben egg rolls. The southwest lacked flavor and the sauce it came with tasted like vinegar. The Reuben egg rolls were delicious! The pretzel cheese was bland, they should use cheese whiz or a beer cheese... But the pretzel was greasy, soft, and delicious. The monster burger came with deep fried jalapeños and onions rings. They needed to be deep fried more and we're kind of gooey. The burger was uh... Okay I guess. They used liquid smoke which I hate. I felt like I was eating a campfire to be honest. The bar itself is super chill and laid back, with tons of tv, slot machines, and great decor. The bar staff was all women and they were super friendly.
Everything about this place is great.  Perfect for a beer guy that hangs out with mixed drink people.  Great food and vibe!

Beers were great.....   Once we got the bartender to come around.   Perhaps she was having an off night, perhaps her boyfriend and her had a fight ?   I'm not sure, but what I am sure of.....    I waited 15 minutes and multiple failed attempts at making eye contact to ask for a food menu.    My wife would try to engage her in simple conversation and was met with no response other than the back of her head as she walked away.      In summation, beer selection : FANTASTIC
staff : meh.       Not to say we won't give them another try, but I hope they have a staff meeting about customer service before we return.

Noticed the cool Rebel Republic sign on my way home from Henderson down Sahara from the city.  Welcoming atmosphere and great selection of brews and food.  Service was perfect (see Dai) and it is definitely a place I would like to come back to.  As a resident of Las Vegas I am always trying out new places.  Great place to bring one or a crowd.

Atmosphere is awesome, waitress is friendly and the food is pretty good (rebel burger). Aerosmith on the speakers and a wall full of craft beer, excellent! 

only thing that kept it from five stars was because there is only 1 bartender here on Friday afternoon with two dozen people, ordering could take a little while.
Stumbled upon this place while using Yelp to find a burger. The Rebel.burger was great. Nice big place, too.
I checked this place out mid-Sunday morning after reading a few Yelp reviews.  Friendly service, good food. If you want something off menu, they will make it.

Great food, great beers, friendly people.
Tried this place out for the first time last week. Sketchy looking at first based on location but when i walked in, the environment is really inviting, the staff is friendly and helpful, and the food is delicious. My friends and i have decided to forsake almost all other bars and make this the kick it spot.there is a slight bias since its right down the street, but even if it wasn't, it would be well worth the drive. I highly recommend!
Best food in Las Vegas!!!! Get the hangover burger ! You wouldn't regret it ! Drinks are good ! && the service here is amazing! I'll be back once I'm in Vegas again (:

Too bad this place has the worst customer service because the food is good and they have a good selection of craft beers. Apparently you need to sit at the bar in order to get some type of service. We had a party of 6 sitting at the tables across the bar and if we needed to order anything we had to go up and get it ourselves (according to the blonde bartender). So sad because they weren't even busy. A group of medical students came in a bit later to eat and poor things weren't even served. One of the busboys brought them water and after about 20minutes of being ignored they walked out. At that point there were 2 bartenders and 1 busboy. The guy and lady bartenders were totally worthless.  They don't make eye contact and they are not aware of their surroundings. The wait time here makes you NEVER want to come back again. Too many other places here in Vegas.

Everytime I come by, this place is on point. Many craft beer options and food all night! Thanks for putting me onto the Jameson Black Barrel. The happy hour menu food is perfect when you want to drink more but not have a hangover next day. The breakfast is always really bomb, but the burgers take the crown. Juicy and full of flavor and big! 
Tha ambience is really nice too. Big board showing all the beer options, along with easy to read beer lists. This place has Big Dogs' beers, Teneya Creek, and even local brewery HopNuts' beers. Ive came in around 10 am for breakfast but i mostly come in after midnight to 4 am.

I've come here on a couple occasions and I like the atmosphere this place. Reminds me of the bars I would go to in the bay (R.I.P Dan Browns). This place has a seasonal rotation, a large number of beers on tap, and in the bottle. Recommend the Rueben Eggrolls, if you're a Rueben fan like I an these are awesome. Honestly a great place to unwind afterwork and catch up with some friends or catch a late dinner. The staff is nice, super knowledgeable about the beer and will help you find something new to try. 

Honestly, this will most likely be my go-to bar for when I just need a beer and decompress after work.
Cool local bar, really good food and a extensive collection of beers on tap. Plenty of tvs for watching sports and the staff is good.
Nice out of the way sports bar. Friendly staff, good food and beer! I recommend giving them a try.
I just love this place. Great staff great food and 52 craft beers on tap. What a great addition to the neighborhood. A must visit bar.
Love this bar. Robert is an awesome owner and hands on. The bar staff is on your drinks and you will never have an empty glass.

This place is really a diamond in the rough. I love that their happy starts early (2-6). We ordered the southwestern egg rolls, avocado tempura, and Kobe sliders - all $5 each during happy hour. The food is amazing. The beer is even more amazing. The bartender gave me two suggestions and both were two of the best beers I've ever had. Love love love this place.
Just left and I have to say the service is 10 times better. I would love for this to be my neighborhood bar and they are well on the way. BTW...the bloody Mary is awesome!

Love this place! Been here three times now. First time checking out during the graveyard happy hour tonight after work. Good selection of craft beers on tap. The bartender, Larry, is amazing! Ask him to make you a Lorenzo shot! It's basically a Kamakaze shot with a bit of a kick! Delicious! Overall, good vibe and atmosphere! Definitely plan on being a regular here. :)

Another local hang near downtown. So far, they have the best happy hour chicken wings. The place is clean and the staff is friendly. I see coming back another time. Went in the afternoon, so, looking forward to hanging at night and see what the vibe is like.

The first time I visited, it was great. Larry, the bartender during graveyard is great. He let us sample the beers we were interested in and the service was great. I've been back twice since then and I was very disappointed each time. The bartenders took at least 10 minutes to acknowledge our presence and it wasn't even busy. The beer wasn't cold and served in warm glasses. I will go back but only when Larry is working.

I can see how people consider this such a weird location.. It is. Especially when you compare the outside neighborhood to the inside. It's in the super ghetto complex with CVS and Tuxedo Junction (to the right of both) on the NE corner of Valley View and Sahara.

The decor inside is nice. Like super nice for a craft beer/sports bar. It's like what every other fancy beer bar (Yard House) was trying for but just plain "cheaped out" on when it came to design. The nice comfy chairs will totally guarantee I will be back to gamble some more just out of pure comfort. There's a few long benches/long booths along the walls and plenty of TVs throughout.

Beers: 48 taps plus 4 locals. The selection is good. Today (4/25/15) I'm enjoying a Cismontane Marea Roja (sour) at $6. Decent price. There's also some Deschutes, Firestone, Evil Twin, Ninkasi, Pelican, Stone, ect. There's also about 30 bottled including some gluten free beers and a Samuel Smith Chocolate Stout (which I believe is organic). Bottles range from $4 (domestic doo doo) to $13 for a Chimay Blue. Taps are $3 to $7 including a now tapped out (aka totally gone) Stone Hibiscusicity that was $3. Bummer I missed that. 

I was craving some fried pickles ($6) so when I checked out the menu on the website (Yelp, thanks Autumn!) a trip over here was a no brainer. Food came out pretty fast and was super hot. The fried pickles are delicious. Pretty unique with the homemade batter (buttermilk, super fluffy) compared to others I've had around town. The pickles are pickle chips FYI (my favorite).

Gaming, tons of beers and very friendly service (Sachi? was super friendly and super cute, she gave me tasters of a few beers without even having to ask!). Everyone else seemed to be enjoying their time during my stay. I will be back.

Oh and the bar is smokers friendly but you really can't tell and the bathrooms were a step above PTs (clean and usable).

Being this place is less than a half mile from my house,  I'm slowly but surely making it my regular spot. All kinds of beer on tap, pool table, sports, darts. Just an overall pretty chill spot. Perfect after a long day at work. Friday and Saturday nights seem to be the most busy with a younger crowd which is perfect for my girlfriend and I. Bartenders are pretty cool as well.

The beer list is impeccable!  Over 50 craft beers on tap.  We had a large party for NFL playoffs & Carla never let our glass go empty.  Carla provides the best service & recommendations - and always with a smile!  Great deals on food & plenty of TVs!!!

Bartender Missy super cool and funny.  The chicken wings are great they have a asian flair to them.  Egg Rolls not a fan.  My friends like the fried pickles I wasn't to fond of them.  The brownie sundae is super delicious. I definitely want to come back and try more food here.  They have so many beers to choose from that change.  Pool tables in the back, good little hang out and a late night happy hour that starts at 1am-5am

My 1st time here. They have an impressive number of taps (approx 50 taps), and Wendy the bartender is very knowledgeable about the taps. It's laid back on this Tues night, but probably pretty lively on game night.
Waited 10 minutes at the bar and never got waited on. Bartender wouldn't even look at us. It wasn't even busy maybe 10 people. It's like they didn't want our business. Fine. Don't bother.
If your looking for a bar with a great beer selection, tasty appetizers and decent prices , this place is great. Plenty of TVs for sports.

Love the staff at this new place!  The food here is amazing, usually have 2 ciders and a burger. Kobe beef is served in a full size burger or sliders,  the sliders are crisp but soft inside.  Have tried a variety of plates on the menu and have not been disappointed.

Great place with awesome staff! My wife and I were in town and were looking for something local. And this place was great! Lots and lots of beer choices with the bar being in the center of a huge rectangular area. TVs were easy to view and the food was great. The onion rings were great! My wife ordered the philly cheese steak, and I ordered the Eastwood burger. Both were good.

The awesome bar tender greeted us with a friendly "hello" as we walked in which made us feel right at home. I am terrible with names and now feel bad that I can't remember her name so other patrons can ask for her. She really made our visit a great experience!

Thank you!

Phil. Great bartender. I instantly like him. I major reason I'm going back. 
Beer selection. Very good, large, and moderately priced. But nothing that really sticks out as unique.
All the servers are cicerones. That's pretty cool! 
Food...It looked good??
Location is pretty nice and so is the layout. It plays out like what is becoming the style in most other cities, but Las Vegas tends to lack.

Also stopped by Rebel Republic for a few this place does have 50 some odd beers on tap. Really cool atmosphere and staff even got to hang out with the cook for a minute.  Smoked turkey anything is a must. I had the club.  So good I ordered the turkey salad to go to take back to the room. TV s everywhere you look and all sports. ....perfect. Definitely going to return soon for a burger next time. I heard those are great too.
Nothing bad to say about this place except that their calamari is terrible. I mean I understand it's a bar and don't expect like 5 star dining, but it came out so soft and wet. It was just bad.
First time few nights ago. Much better than PTs, less smoke, good food. My calamari was a little bland and soggy, but everything else was great!

Bartender Larry is the best! Very welcoming and laid back. Got to know each other a little and he knew a little about my hometown- Maui, Hawaii. 

Drove up to the place and noticed it was a place with not so much foot traffic. But once you step in, you'll realize you're at a bar that isn't over crowded and will have that intimate modern feeling. 

Over 50+ beers on tap; Larry will give you the pleasure of tasting a beer on tap before purchasing. Give him a specific brew style and he'll be on it! 

Didn't have spare change for the pool table, but the bartender was kind enough to spare us some change, as we told him we'll give him a generous tip towards the end!! ;)

Defiantly not your average bar food. Chicken wings, Kobe sliders & "Big Boy" cheese steak is a must! 

Will be back for sure and will be bringing a bunch of friends the next time around!!

Thought the place was closed by first looks but thankfully we went in! This place has amazing food, probably the best I've had in a bar/pub ever! To top of the amazing food they have over 50 beers to choose from and the environment is chill. Highly recommend and definitely going back!
Redic selection of beer and liquor. Couches, pool and darts. Workers are nice although short staffed at times, but always great attitude.

Meats are smoked! Taste is beyond flavorful! Fries are so good!! Ruben was very large and done well.  Salad could be larger but for the price but the amount of meat is spot on. Staff was very attentive

Thank you to the Weekly Yelp for leading us here! If you follow me on Yelp you must know I love great burgers. Once I saw this Weekly Yelp about "Not Yo Daddy's Burger" I noticed I've already gone to each featured burger joint except Rebel Republic!!! So, came here right away for dinner last night. 

Because of the great reviews and pictures, we anticipated for it to be crowded with a long wait..... Nope! Haha it's located in some corner of some deserted plaza. Seriously like a "diamond in a rough" the entrance is DOPE with the turf, tables, art work and tv's then you walk in and there's the large bar in the center and along the sides are the booths.

We didn't understand why it wasn't packed on a Friday night because shoot because shoot - we found our new spot!!
The menu is filled with awesome choices, beer selection is amazing and the atmosphere was just perfect. I got the Reuben Burger with onion rings (best onion rings ever) and my BF got the Hangover Burger with seasoned fries. The burgers were massive and tasted amazeballs. 

Definitely coming back!!!

Checked this place out while in Vegas a few weeks ago.  The place is awesome and the server was a hoot!  We all had the burgers and everyone thought that they were really some of the best burgers they have had.  Check it out, it is worth it and we will definitely be back next time we are in town.
The bartenders that are there in the evening are pathetic.. We had to keep waitin for our checks.. One of our friends didnt even get her order taken the whole time she was there! Pathetic service!

Hidden gem of a hipster bar- love the wood paneling and rustic tables, tufted leather seating, chalkboard menu specials, and animal heads. And that's just the décor!

Menu  twists staple bar fare items, service is attentive, and there are more than enough TV screens to watch all the games at once. Plus, their football specials can easily save you 30% to stuff your face while watching your team.

Favorite items included the Reuben pastrami eggrolls (better than the ham and cheese version), the fried Kobe sliders (small but pack a punch of flavor), and the wings are worth getting with or without a discount.
Not-so-successful items were the avocado tempura (odd mix of textures, not much flavor) and the fried pickles (small portion, flavorless breading). Many of the items were a bit on the salty side- went well with their beers though, extensive draft selection.

This was a great find - thanks Yelp! It's a cool neighborhood bar at the end of a strip mall. Very easy to miss if you aren't looking for it. They have great happy hour deals. And there's some interesting food items, like rueben egg rolls. They also have a lengthy list of craft beers on tap, which is the major draw here. Ambiance and decor are nice. It's chill and comfy. There's video poker, of course. And they do comp the fancy beers if you're playing. Very friendly bartender. Be sure to sign up for the players card so you can get $10 in free slot play. All in all, we had an enjoyable time here. The creative pub food offerings and extensive beer list are a big draw here that will have us coming back.

I found out about this new little bar in an article " Top Ten Bars In Las Vegas". I was looking for something centrally located, off the strip with a great beer selection, decently priced, good food, and an enjoyable setting. This place exceeded my expectations! The beer knowledge of all the staff alone blew me away! The selection is impeccable. I have been searching high and low for New Belgium's Lips of Faith series La Folie ( a Brown Sour) and they have it on tap!!!! I had the BBQ sliders. Wow! The food was delicious. The presentation, the bold flavors, and the fact that their meats are slow cooked and smoked in house. I can't wait to try them all! Katy and Larry took amazing care of us and I will be returning on a regular basis! These guys did it right. Must check this bar out!

When in to this joint and wow !!!! The bartenders here are down to earth and the food is amazing !! Try the rebel Ruben egg rolls .... They have gaming but it's not my thing ..... They have seating for family ... And 52 craft beers

Pastrami egg rolls are outrageous good 
Best onion ring I have ever had!!!!
Great food, service and prices!
Can't wait to visit Vegas again!
We ate there 3 times in 2 days!

So my friends and i, who are all in the bar industry, stopped by there tonight (7/2/15 around 11:40am). They had gotten there before me, I came over after I got off work. We all waited about 25 mins, before we were even approached to have our drink orders taken. To put it in an even better perspective, we each almost gambled $40 before we were approached. The only reason we didn't, is because we stopped gambling.... one of the female bartenders even came over to get one of my friends shot order that a regular customer was buying for him from across the bar (he was good friends with that particular regular), and i didnt even get acknowledged then, and I was sitting right next to my friend getting the shot, gambling, no drink in hand! The only reason the one of THREE bartenders came over and took my order, was because my friend finally waived her down to get her attention.....and I didn't receive a smile, a hello, a how or you, nothing. She walked around the bar as if she had no purpose for 5 mins, and EATING, before coming to tell me she was out of orange juice for my drink. Really? I understand I got there 20 mins before shift change, but even the grave bartender didn't come over and greet us after he got settled. We were all severely unimpressed with this experience, and I personally wont be back. If I was the owner/manager/investor.... I would seriously reconsider your staff.

I would give this place a "5" star rating except for the smoking. It smells gross in there to a non smoker.  We stayed anyway and I'm glad we did. We came to watch a game - great TV viewing from anywhere in the bar. Comfy seats, big screens. The food. Oh the food. RIDICULOUS. everything on the appetizer menu was good. You know how I know?  Apps and beers were in a "happy hour" menu for the entire game!  What?  So we tried everything. Get the wings. They are the best wings I've ever had. And the onion rings. Wow. Yep our whole bill was $52 after 3.5 hours.  Great service too. Loved it!

Rebel Republic has an amazing selection of craft beers. I love trying different flavors of beer and was intrigued by the peanut butter flavors that were listed and decided to try them both. The first one was the Horny Goat Chocolate Peanut Butter Porter. This was a dark beer and tasted like a dark chocolate peanut butter cup with no sugar. The next one was a bit more mild, the Belching Beaver Peanut Butter. Also a dark beer, but was a tad bit sweeter than the other. I had the genius idea to mix the two together, and I actually really enjoyed the combination of both. My friends ordered mixed drinks and said they were very strong, so that is definitely a plus. And they were very reasonably priced. FYI with your Yelp check in you get a free PBR.

I loved the interior of this place. It's very log cabin esque. There is bench-style wooden seating along the wall, and a comfy couch and oversized leather chair in the back by the pool table. Wall hangings included animal heads and vintage signs as well as flat screen tv's. The inside was dimly lit and many of the tables had small tea candles lit. The vibe was laid back and chill. 

The bartenders were a bit off putting. We walked up to the bar and they didn't even look up from what they were doing to say hello, or be right with you. A few minutes later one of the girls finally stopped what she was doing to help us and she ended up being very helpful and friendly. She knew her beers and also made some suggestions based on what we liked. 

Although we just came here for drinks, we all decided that we would be coming back to try some of the yummy food, mainly the Reuben egg rolls.

Pastrami egg rolls.  I could end the review after those 3 words, since they are what solidified the 5 stars on this review, they're THAT good.  

52 beers on tap?  People have mentioned those before, and they're amazing.  There truly is a craft beer here for all preferences and desired alcohol content.  If you just order Bud Light/Miller Light/PBR I feel like you deserve to be judged...

Finally, a beer club, with a free beer once a month? Sold. This is one of my favorite spots out here now- NHL ticket, tons of TVs for NFL, great staff and fun vibe.
Service was Good and the bar is cool. Avacado tempura is yummy! Food had good presentation but lacked flavor. Bathrooms were dirty.

Rebel Republic is an absolutely fantastic spot that for whatever reason is not getting the business that it deserves, probably from a lack of advertisement and it's slightly secluded location tucked away in a shopping center at W Sahara and Valley View.  As a swing bartender, most of my experiences there have been during the graveyard shift.   When I first stepped foot in there, I was immediately marveled by the incredible draft beer selection (52!!!!).  Not only that, but several of the beers are on rotation so I know that every time I go back there are new things to try.  

Whereby the majority of the staff is friendly, knowledgeable, and professional, I have been most impressed by a few of the graveyard staff.  Larry, was the first to break me into the incredible beer menu.  He is so good with the beers that he often knows what to suggest to me based on prior selections.  Some nights, I don't know what to drink so I tell him to send me on a craft beer journey, and he never disappoints.  He's also a consummate host, always ensuring that his clientele is comfortable, happy, and fed.  

As a gamer, I enjoy their machines.  The poker plays very well, although I haven't had too much success with any jackpots.  However, I can usually salvage a night with a fun romp with the video Black Jack.  

Larry also turned me on to the food menu, first starting me off with the Kobe sliders.  They are original, delicious, and full of flavor.  Also, they are on the late-night happy hour, which is a fantastic program, especially for those of us working late into the evening (or morning).  From there, he moved me onto other fantastic dishes and sandwiches.  The tempura avocado is a personal favorite of mine.  I never thought that avocado would go so well in that style, but with the help of the phenomenal graveyard chef, Antwan (spelling?) they are always a hit from their perfect crispness to the delicious dipping sauce.  While mentioning Antwan, he is so much more than just a cook.  He always ensures that the guests are fully stocked with silverware, napkins, or condiments of any kind, and he is always open and friendly.

Although I have been there on other shifts, graveyards with Larry and Antwan are absolutely my favorite.  They are so much fun that I've made a regular evening after work with a group of friends on Wednesdays (Thursday mornings).  I suggest Rebel Republic as a gathering place whenever friends want to get together and try something new.  

I will continue to frequent this establishment, and I hope it continues in the fantastic fashion that it has started.  Larry and Antwan are incredible assets to this company and I look forward to seeing them every time I go.  

Simply put, the combination of great food, an amazing beer and drink selection, and devoted and knowledgeable staff makes Rebel Republic an outstanding destination for anyone looking for a great spot offering excellence at any hour of the day or night!

This bar is amazing!!! There is always a good rotation of beers and the food is on point, so delicious. All the bartenders are knowledgable with the beers and very tentative. If you are looking for great beer and amazing prices this is definitely the place to go!!!

This was not what I expected we got some bad service food was really salty and oily.  the regulars were complaining about the music I played on the juke box so they refused to play my purchased songs and returned my money. They really made me feel out of place, NEVER GOING BACK NOT WORTH IT!

The bar staff is awesome Melissa is so friendly and courteous, she is always right there to say hi when you walk in and ensures you are attended to right away! She is an awesome bartender. The beer selection is the best I have found in town with brewers from all over and tap take over parties!

why do they still let one jerks smoke in here?? I was hopeful this time around but unfortunately smoking is still around food.  Not just at the slot machines at the bar but also at the tables against the wall.  I was here on 1/22/17 for the championship football games and Steve,  the blonde lady and sachiyo all let patrons smoke next to the vast amount of customers that were eating. I am going to contact the health department again!!!

Came to rebel republic to have some drinks with friends. I didn't try the food so this review is strictly on the atmosphere and bar. The bartender Steed was a riot. The bar has a internet jukebox machine that actually has a pretty good selection of music. Played some video poker and actually won $250. I'll be back :)

If you're a fan of good beers and great food, Rebel Republic is the place for you. Sachi my regular bartender and does a tremendous job both with her knowledge of the drinks and with her recommendations for new things to try. Marissa (AKA Denver) is a fan of my favorite football team and another outstanding bartender to have. Really, you can't go wrong with any of the staff here. Be sure to try the avocado tempura, french fries, sweet potato fries, and Reuben egg rolls. You'll be glad you did!

Great bar. Everyone's friendly and bartenders are knowledgeable about the beer....the menu is is great and food comes out quickly rebel wings are amazing....great place to be first happy hour. You wanna escape the tourist and strip and just have a drink and vibe with locals hit rebels

First off I want to say this hidden jewel is just that! I never would have found it if I didn't work next to it. I love that they serve breakfast and I recommend the breakfast tacos. If you order breakfast between 6am and 9am it is half off. The food is delicious and reasonable prices.
Not quite a Dive bar, but close. As we love it. Lots of good beer selections. Friendly service. And the burgers were quite tasty.. Will go back!

This place was great!! Me and some friends were shopping around for fantasy football specials, this place by far had the best deal which came with free hats & shirts!! The staff was great, the food was awesome! Ill definitely be back.

Good food, Great service!

Make sure you see Larry my new favorite bartender, he "knows" his beers and they have a lot to choose from!  Nice to the locals and great for night shift workers.  Surprisingly delicious menu - not just typical "bar food". 

I'm hooked...finally a nice place to enjoy great drinks, a little gambling, awesome food menu and a great staff.

Went in for some drinks with friends Fri night, and they had an amazing beer selection. Ordered quite a few apps, and they were all delicious!! The Reuben egg rolls are to die for!!! Left my CC card by accident, so enjoyed a nice Bloody Mary while grubbing on some breakfast. Again, really good!!
The beer selection was pretty darn impressive and the food was pretty decent as well. If your looking for a laid-back place to grab a beer and scarf down some good pub food, this is the place.

Love this place!! First time going there and they had great service,  great food and tons of craft beers on tap!! The waitress was super nice she let my cousin and I take Irish car bombs w a peanut butter stout on nitro!!!  And it was delicious!! Thank you to the waitress for allowing us to do that!! Oh and I highly recommend trying the spicy chicken sandwich!!! It was very good!  They also have good tvs there to watch sports!  We went there initially to catch the warriors game!

Rebel republic for late night happy hour. Read about the Reuben egg rolls & I had to come in & try 'em. Now I'm not usually even a Reuben sandwich guy, but I have to say these are F@$king delicious!! Pastrami, Swiss & sauerkraut with there special rebel sauce. The bartender Steed was hella cool! I will definitely be back to try more.

Gosh, I love this place. The staff is always so wonderful and the food is to die for. Management has this place on fleek!!!! The drinks are great and 52 crazy beers on tap?? I'll be back. Good mix of people and everyone feels like family. You gotta get the philly egg rolls! And the onion rings!

This place reminds me of PT's and PKWY Tavern combined, but smaller and quieter. It's a good place to get away that isn't overly crowded. The food is really good and the selection of beer is awesome. Service is amazing too...very attentive!

So many things to like about Rebel. I can't give it 5 stars because of the smoke. It's too much to ask to drink my Lagunitas Born Yesterday without secondhand smoking a dozen cigs but such is life. 

The things they do have going for them though, are going splendidly. They have a great selection of taps and they usually have something new to try when I pop in. If they blow a keg of your favorite brew, never fear, chances are they have something equally good to replace it with. 

I'm not a huge fan of bar food so there aren't a ton of options here for me to chose from. I eat the fries. As far as french fries go, these are decent. They're fat steak fries not the annoying shoestring version. The fish tacos are a good option too but they aren't listed on the menu so I'm not sure if the tacos are there to stay. 

The bartenders (a few of them at least) recognize me, which I like. They know what I drink and greet me with a sample if they have something new on tap they think I might enjoy. Cool. Go for the beer, stay cause the people pouring it are pretty cool.

This was a great  experence. The food was fresh and the service was great. The waitress, Missy, even waited for us to finish praying to deliver the condiments. The only down side was some of the music was a bit vulgar; however we are at a bar.

Love, Love, LOVE this place.  52 beers on tap?  YES!  And some of the best beers around.. Stone, Rogue, Alesmith, Green Flash.. 

The staff is ALWAYS phenomenal.  Wendy is great behind the bar with quick refills, and always a smile.  Plus she knows pretty much everything there is to know about the beers, so her recommendations are spot on.

The prices are great, especially for the typically more expensive crafts.  

Definitely a place we will frequent.

Visit at your own risk!  The staff is super accommodating to the regulars, but ask a few questions and you'll ruin their day. We apparently went in on a bad day. The woman in pleather pants behind the bar said she was the owner, so I guess she felt she had the right to scream and curse at us when we inquired about the video poker 'malfunction' instead of paying out the bonus spin. Obviously now you're thinking, "There must be two sides to this story." However, my witness is a Nevada Gaming Commission official and he had to intervene on my behalf. (Will provide his name and badge number, if requested, but it wouldn't be fair to drag him into this review here.)
 In fact, pleather-pants lady drummed up the crowd against us and incited one of the heftier locals to follow us out. As if we were enjoying her caterwaling so much we would want to stay in there.
I'm not telling you not to visit or to visit. I am recommending you read the other reviews about how non-regulars are treated and make your own decision whether you want to take the risk.

A local pub that has an amazing and welcoming staff. They have an exceptionally wide beer selection on tap. The bathrooms are clean, comfortable seating, a most amazing menu of food, Televisions on every wall, NFL Sunday ticket, awesome beer specials($2 PBR on tap and many more), and everything you could possibly ask for in a bar. If you're looking for a great atmosphere and the real Las Vegas, you should be here.

I came here to meet up with a group. We hung out in the back by the pool table and couches. Perfect for a big party with ~20 to 30 people. Not ideal for two big parties at the same time. The fries, chicken wings, jalepeno poppers, bacon eggrolls, and veggie sticks made excellent finger foods. Bartenders were quick with the drinks and there is ample parking outside. Perfect spot to kick back, relax, and enjoy a beer.

Great beer selections-over 50 beers on tap. The staff was friendly and courteous. The food was great. The rebel burger was yummy! Cool place to watch sports. Plenty of TVs for all sport games. The atmosphere is cool! Got a really good vibe! Will be back for sure!
Awesome knowledgeable staff, great food, 52+ cold brews, HOT machines and TVs galore!!  Football specials and happy hour during the week!  Definitely should add as a weekly check-in spot!!!

I enter, guns and roses are playing(is that a jukebox?), a group of douchebags looks at me, I sit. The bar is centered and in a standard U shape. The decor wallside consists of a mix of TV's, portraits that are barely visible(given the lighting is dim and relax), black boards with drink descriptions, a big clock, a bust of a deer and a fish. Oh, and a projector screen.

The beer: The draft selections are numerous. The menu for each is on a rough tapestry type of paper; all hail liquid courage.  I prefer IPA and the menu is already amazing me with all these different types that I've never tried. On the back and bottom a note in red states that there are more in bottles, which can be seen on a separate list. I'm alone and will stick to just one IPA, Lagunitas. My shit. 

The liquor: Vodka, Whiskey, Rum and Gin. They have it all. 

The menu: I came here looking for a burger. I opened the menu and the options like most menus was seperated by appetizers, sandwhiches, burgers, meals and more. I wanted a burger as stated before, the choices were between an "eastwood" (there take of a western burger), the hangover, Reuben burger and well I can't remember the last one, but it was the last burger on the list. I'm sure if you come here with an appetite for a drink and are hungry or become hungry, you won't be disappointed. 

The service: I received the standard attention from a bartender(one of three) servicing 10 plus customers and 3 plus groups. I never felt like I was waiting long to receive a refill and the food came within 15 minutes of ordering. Speaking of....

The food: I received my food in a timely manner. And oh man, was I in for a treat. So the burger I chose was the Reuben burger, it's a patty with pastrami and other amazing things. The fries are home made, thick huge and bomb Diggity. The entire entree came in a metal basket with a handle.  That's pretty cool. 

The bite: My first bite after a few fries, my salivatory glands started aching,  it was so good. Oh crap. Did I find the best burger in Vegas? SO FAR. Hell yes!! 

Overall: The music was good if you like rock, the drinks were good if you like to get drunk, and the food...if you want to battle your hangover; this the place. 

I'm going to give this establishment 5 stars.
I have tried different pubs and this was so so, I do recommend the philly egg roll if you go

I don't write bad reviews...
I'm so disappointed. Tina and her assistant bar tender ignored us all night. I waited 10 minutes just for then to acknowledge me. Once they did they were attentive. Which was great. But the last they could do was say, "I'll be right with you" most of the time they were taking amongst themselves, ignoring customers. Our group brought lots if money in but no one spent it because no one helped us. OWNERS take care of that! Also the calamari recipe has changed at least 3 times. Used to be amazing. Now plain awful

Went in here earlier there beer list is amazing they have something for everybody I'm not a big beer girl but they let me taste test and I found something for me 

Course I liked the expensive beers lol

I came in on swing and left on grave but both bartenders were super nice and made sure I was so well taken care off :)

From 3/11/15

The over 50 different kinds of beer is what brought us in here. However, I  decided on Moscow Mules, and the boyfriend got the beers. Maybe next time I decided on a beer bender I will do it here.

This place has a really cool atmosphere; I like the way they place the in the middle of the seating on each side. The bartenders made my Moscow Mules so good, and strong. My boyfriend  got the Big Eddy's Cherry Doppleschwarz, Anita Grapefruit IPA Coronado Orange Wit. I had to sample  some of his beers, and they were petty dam good. 

I can easily see us becoming regulars here because it's a great bar with excellent drinks and good service

If you're into huge burgers this is the place for you! A friend suggested we try this place for lunch.  It sits on a corner of the plaza, not hard to find. There's a covered patio out front for dining. When the weather's nice it'll be cool to sit out with a nice cold one.  Inside along the walls are booths and barstools. Plenty of room to sit and chill before your food comes out. The bar has all the top shelf brands. There's tv's at the top of the bar. The music is great, my friend and I sung just about every song that came on. 

The menu has something for everyone. For apps we orders cheese curds and fried pickles. I've never had cheese curds but these were delicious! They were fried just right.  The pickles were awesome too! They're cut the long way but not greasy at all. I ordered a Swiss cheese burger, the party had to be 2" thick,  and seasoned well.  My friend ordered chicken wings. The way those wings were battered and fried reminded me of southern cooking. Cooking like that is hard to find in a restaurant. The waitress/bartender was polite, inviting, and professional. 

The menu has a lot of great deals, especially for taco Tuesday's. Tuesday's they offer $2 tacos and margarita specials. They also offer happy hour specials on wings, nachos, and apps starting at $5. This place is great!!
Great food and different beers! What more could you want? One of my favorite bars in Vegas!

This is my favorite local bar around this area. From the looks on the outside, you may be a little hesitant to come inside but don't let that fool you. They have a great happy hour menu along with tons of beers to satisfy your belly. The food is fantastic as well and I've tried pretty much everything on the menu. It's a perfect place to watch any sports event since they are a sports bar lol. So come on down to Rebel Republic and have a drink or two with locals instead of paying those high Strip prices.

I rarely write reviews and when i do...it's either i really really love you...or really really dislike you!!!

Food: it was not bad...when they brought out my fiance's calamari, i thought it was chicken wings at first coz it was shaped odd (like a surfboard, instead of the strips/rings that im used to)...for $9, i expected a bigger portion. Good flavors, otherwise.

The korean bbq sandwich gets a thumbs up for me. 

$5 for a teeny kobe beef slider...really?

My fiance got one of their burgers (the Eastwood) and was not impressed. For the price we're paying, we're better off at Bachi burger. My fiance was not thrilled with the "meh" burger so he was just nibbling at it. (since he did pay $13 for such a mediocre entree)

I ordered a side of sweet potato fries. Our server/bartender Missy gave me regular fries instead and i pointed that out to her and she said she'll bring me the correct one....and i've never seen those fries for the rest of the night

This was our first stop of the night and it was cold outside and a bit chilly inside...so the kicker of it all was when Missy knocked a full glass of Dr. Pepper on my fiance's lap. Imagine, in the dead of winter, having an icy beverage spilled all over your jeans and you have plans to go later!!!! The busser was kind enough to mop the floors and apologize profusely.

So nearing the end of our meal, my fiance was the only left slowly munching on his mediocre burger. He was distracted talking to our big group of friends so tell me why Missy takes his burger and fries away without asking him!!! When she came back, he told her he wasnt done and she said "i saw napkins on top of it and thought you were done". Liar! There wasnt any napkins of top of his burger. I saw her put a dirty napkin on top of it and took it away!

She apologized and offered to grab him another burger or take it off the tab.

My fiance works in the restaurant biz so instead of Missy telling the manager the issues we've been having at our table, we had to flag the manager down to complain! Why wasnt this automatic, Missy?? You should let your manager know when there are issues IMMEDIATELY because the you want to please your paying customers!!!!

So when my fiance explained to the manager what happened, tell me why this manager says, "What would you like me to do about it?"

As a manager, you should first, apologize then say something like "let me take that off your bill". Why would you ask the customer what you want them to do? Dont you think it's embarrassing if the customer tells you..."oh, you take that off my bill".....The right thing to do is tell the customer that u'll take it off immediately, especially considering all the cr*p that happened to us. (my fiance told me this is what their managers do for their customers to keep them happy & for them to come back at his restaurant. )

The crowd: Tell me why our friends were the most diverse ppl in that whole restaurant??...i think majority of the crowd that was there saturday night were bikers and dudes wearing swastika, neo nazi shirts.....not cool if you have a crew with black, asian and hispanic ppl....but then again, we probably just went on a cr*ptastic night.

For a better variety of beers and fantastic food at reasonable prices (esp during their happy hour)...ur better off at Yard House!

Ok...enough of my PMS...

time for a donut.

oink

I came here last week and ordered Kobe beef sliders and a beer. I would probably come here just for the Kobe beef sliders. They were so flavorful and I loved how the meat was formed into a crispy meatball. They also have an extensive selection of beer which I love because I've been getting more and more into beer lately! The waitress that helped us was very friendly and made a lot of recommendations for our beer/food selections. My boyfriend ordered a burger and fries and they ended up giving us two baskets of fries, just so we could both try them out. I really liked the texture of the fries and the fact that they were very thin and crispy, but they were a little too salty for my liking. I feel like that isn't usually how their fries are though since a lot of people say the fries are BOMB in their reviews. 

After we ate, the waitress recommended we check out the other side of the bar where they have dart boards. We grabbed some darts from the bartender and started playing. I definitely need some more practice, which gives me more of an excuse to come here!

Food this good should not be coming from a bar in strip mall, but good lawd!

I know what you're thinking, "5 stars for a Gastro Pub?", seriously though this place has some of the best bar food I've eaten in a long time and I use the term, "bar food" loosely. I mean house smoked Pastrami Egg Rolls, Fried Kobe Beef Sliders and a insane calamari dish. Who's the f**king mad scientist in the kitchen?!

Rebel Republic is tucked away in a random strip mall off Sahara Ave. and the only reason I was able to spot it, is because of their giant glowing neon blue ribbon sign. Finally, all those years of drinking that terrible PBR slop are paying off. When you walk up to Rebel Republic you first notice a keen little patio area outside of the restaurant possibly for sipping and sampling. I got here around 1a.m. and it was still too hot to eat outside, so I decided to belly up to the bar.  

The beer selection can be overwhelming even to the most veteran hop heads. From what I understand they have over 52 beers on tap at all times, which is music to my ears; "I'll start with the Dogfish Head 60 Minute IPA". As I sipped my beverage, I noticed that the menu items here were very intriguing. "Bartender, who's in charge of the food?" "Oh, we hired a chef to come in and revamp the menu and then teach the permanent chefs how to prepare each item"... Oh you fancy huh?

This made sense.  As I stated in the first paragraph the food here is amazing and is made fresh to order 24 hours a day! Literally you can get Kobe Beef Sliders at four in the morning... how awesome is that? Speaking of the super sliders, these are amazing little bites of heaven, perfectly cooked, seasoned, and placed between two soft pillows of sweet bread. Oh mama!

The Pastrami Egg Rolls is pretty much exactly what it sound like. You know, delicious! Salted cured meat, wrapped in filo-dough, deep fried, and served with a house made thousand island sauce. Seriously, this goes great with a solid IPA.

The final thing I decided on was the calamari. This comes in a bowl with pickled seaweed. (I'm not sure about that?) These tasty morsels resemble that of a sweet and sour chicken, but taste just like perfectly cooked calamari with a spicy, saucy coating. I almost ordered another round. 

RR has a very chill vibe and the decor of a Midwestern family's basement. Animal heads and wood paneling for days. Plus the servers here are very helpful when it to comes to ordering beers. They will have a beer sample ready and in your hand before you can even ask the question, "is that a hoppy beer?" 

PRO TIP: Check-In when you arrive and get a $2 PBR. If you're into that sort of thing.

Rebel Republic is seriously my FAVORITE find of 2015!!! I honestly can't find anything wrong with this place, even it's location! Located on Sahara almost right across from Herbs and Rye, which makes it pretty dangerous for me and my friends since we always come here now after we have some cocktails at Herbs. They are open 24 hours and have a 24 hour kitchen. Yes, I will say it again, 24 hour kitchen offering their FULL menu. And this is not some PT's type grub (not hating on PT's or anything, their 50% off pizzas during happy hour is my ishh) but this place has some quality gastropub goodness with 52 DRAFT BEERS! Holy. And since we always go around the same time, we always see the same bartender who is incredibly friendly and always offers tastings if we're iffy about trying something, he's also made some awesome cocktails on the spot for me and my friends when we weren't feeling beer. I'm not beer drinker but I do love their Blueberry Wheat Beer, Lost Coast Tangerine Wheat or their Grapefruit Ale. From their Small Plates, my favorite has been their Rebel Reuben Eggrolls, basically a Reuben sandwich in eggroll form. As for burgers, I believe I've tried their Monster Burger, Rebel Burger, Eastwood Burger and Hangover Burger. My favorite is definitely between their Monster and Eastwood. The Monster includes jalapeno bacon cream cheese, onion rings, and deep fried jalapenos with bacon, coleslaw and rebel sauce. Phew! This one is deliciously messy. Their Eastwood is basically a take-on a BBQ Bacon Cheeseburger served on a sweet Hawaiian Bun. They also all come with Fries, or you can sub them from sweet potato or onion rings. Even their fries are awesome. Not quite steak fries but pretty thick and flavorful. The only thing I will say kind of eh about their burgers are that no matter how many times I order them and ask from Medium-Rare or any of my friends order Medium, all the burgers always come out Well Done. Always lol but it's fine since the flavor makes up for it but they would be 100x better if they could make it to our preference but oh well! Also one of my friends tried their Philly last time and it was pretty amazing, he said it was the best Philly he's ever had!

This place also has lots of seating and TV's to watch football along with football and happy hour specials. Tons of bar seats and lots of booth styled tables that wrap around the bar and they even have some couches in front of their bigger TV near the pool table and dart section. I like playing pool and darts so I love that Rebel Republic has these also especially since they seem almost new! Another big thing for me is that this place is incredibly clean! No sticky floors, and lots of new decor. Also really clean restrooms. Definitely a regular here! :)
Rebel is awesome! Great bar food and an incredible and always evolving beer list. Been coming here about once a week because it is my neighborhood bar. Sachi is the best! Thank you Rebel!!!

Great selection of beers and a really cool staff.
Check out the beer of the week club: $25 gets you a different beer of the manager's choice every week for a year, free!

Came here w/my kids(their choice) the place is pretty cool. Bar, jukebox, pool table and good grub! My kids ordered a ginger ale & a blueberry My daughter ordered a veggie burger w/sweet potato fries. I tasted the fries and I liked the cinnamon that was on the sweet potato fries. I ordered a hangover burger to go, so I guess I would review that after I eat it@home lol for a Friday night it wasn't busy nor crowded which I liked. And like I said earlier, it's s pretty cool sports bar. Thank u! We'll b back smooches!

We had a good time playing pool and having food until the place was robbed while we were in it. There were about 10 people present, someone said it was a shotgun, someone else said an AK-47. Oh well, can't fault the bar for it. The poutine fries were really tasty. The bartender and cook were friendly too. I'll come back the next time we are in Vegas - a great place to watch sports.

I'm not kidding with this review by the way, see the las vegas crime map to verify my check in and the armed robbery - http://spotcrime.com/nv/las+vegas

First time here and I'm not sure why there are such good reviews. We ordered and it took 30 mins for our food. Then when the food came out, certain items, like my onion rings were cold. To make matters worse, the waitress never came back to us after taking our order. I had to go up to the bar to ask for water. We ended up flagging down a food runner to order a second round of beers. Super disappointing. The food was ok. Beer list was great. Service terrible.
Wonderful food .. came here last week and it was extremely amazing.. I could go here everyday if I could amazing staff as well

This place is not too far away from home. The chalk board showed that they offer a beer club for $60  the whole year so thats something for the beer lovers close by. The digital juke box pays $5 for 10 songs or something like that and the pool table needs $1 in quarters for a game. Love how they have two dart boards and couches to lounge in besides the bar stools and booths. Had a beer and ended in a glass of wine, love how chill this spot is.

They have a bunch of beers including local beers which I love-- Lovelady Golden Nites! I love their happy hour-my favorites are their chili lime wings/tenders, the Reuben egg rolls and the garlic Parmesan fries. Everything is made in-house and you can tell  The machines have been very nice to me the last few times I've played and the staff is amazing.
After waiting one hour and taking our food eventually to go at lunch today, we had the additional unfortunate realization later that our food was terrible to boot. I will not be returning.

Great atmosphere, great service, great food, great beers! Lacey was an amazing server today and always ensures that my party was okay the entire time. I only tried one Kobe slider because I was full when I arrived...but it definitely isn't just a one slider type of burger! It's unlike any burger I've ever tried! Definitely a must for every person that walks in the door. There's also a pool table and darts in the back corner...but the beer selection is number one what I'd come back for. So many more to try! Great spot:)!

I am always looking for new craft beer bars, and Rebel Republic has never showed up when searching online.  When I finally heard about it, the website appeared to be down.  So I had to come to the bar to see first hand what type of selection there was.  

They had about 25 rotating taps and a large bottle list.  They had some rare Stone anniversary brews, many California and Colorado brands, and some local craft as well.  Most ranged from ($6-$8), usual Vegas prices, but there were also a couple beer specials for $3-$5, not macro, but an actual local craft.  The best part is they show the prices of the beer on the menu!  This is very rare in Las Vegas and worth the shout out.

I came on a sunday for football and they had a few beer specials on top of the daily deals, as well as some food specials for $5.  I had the pork sliders and kobe beef sliders.  The pork was good and juicy but the kobe seemed to be a little overcooked.  I will most likely be back to try the burger (looked good) and will absolutely be back to continue tasting specialty craft beers that they offer at a great price.  

And by the way, Rebel Republic is only about 10 minutes from the strip, so come here to watch some sports, drink craft beer, and enjoy yourself off the strip in local Las Vegas.

I am so disappointed .. I really like this bar..  but I brought 4 people with me to watch the vegas golden knights .. the bar has always been big knight fans .. but today they had the basketball game on half the TVs because 2 people wanted to watch the basketball game ..  this is vegas .. first night of Stanley cup and they have half the TVs on basketball ...  I understand to put that game on one tv away from all the other fans ..  but to change the tv in front of twenty Vgk fans because two guys asked for basketball is ridiculous.. and between 1st and 2nd period... who does this?????  It was my local hangout ..  but this is crap...amd I brought 4 people in.. vs the two that asked..  not to mention the others watching ...     they should be ashamed

Have this place bookmarked in my Yelp finally got around to trying it went for lunch the service was amazing Amy was our waitress we asked her what we should try since it's our first time here she suggested the rebel burger and the rebel Big Boy cheesesteak both were super yummy and super amazing the onion rings were yummy the fries not so great can't wait to come back and try more stuff

The Bf & I invited a few friends and decided to check this place out. The place was a little hard to find, kind of hidden in the corner, but definitely worth the effort. 
Great, extensive beer list. I really liked the kronenbourg 1664  Blanc with 5% alcohol. I also liked the beer content being in the menu. Plus they have Titos vodka... Yay!! 

The spicy calamari was amazing. I only wish there was more of it because it was so good! The seaweed underneath complimented it perfectly. I also ordered one of the burgers, without a bun. Very flavorful. They were a little stingy on the fries, but since the bf kept stealing them I can't really complain too much. I think they were just so good that I wanted more of 'em. Yummy in my tummy! 

Service was excellent, bartender Kristyne is friendly and fun. I wish this place was closer to my house, but either way I'll definitely be back. It was a Friday night, and the place was pretty busy. Good quality of people.

I want to love this place!  It's near my home and I love their  beer selection.  52 beers on tap you can't beat that . The problem is the food is terrible.  The burger has pork belly ground in leaving the burger greasy and excuse my French sh****! The fries are an inch to an inch and a half long leaving them too salty and when you dip them in ketchup your fingers have to get wet with the sh**** fries every time. I asked the manager what is good on the menu and he said "to be honest with you nothing is that good" .  The truth hurts. I don't want to bad mouth the pub I want to love, but this is definitely a work in progress. Beer thumbs up, food thumbs down!

Amazing place. Went here to recover after a heroic weekend of drinking and gambling. The hangover burger was the cure to everything. Great bloody mary too!

Highly recommend!!!!  Recharge your batteries before you hit the road or hop on that flight.

Excellent food - POOR service. 
Visited the establishment for the first time last Friday night. We sat at a booth, rather than the bar, my s/o & i both had a long day & wanted to relax. We noticed right away that they seemed short staffed so we were patient & waited for someone to help us. Eventually the same woman bartending, Tina, (only 2 bartenders staffed) came to take our order. Since we figured we wouldn't see her again for a while, we put our entire order in for drinks & food. Everything we ordered tasted delicious & was brought out immediately. We struggled getting refills, utensils, napkins, etc. we asked a bus boy if he could help us out, which he did, so we slipped him a few $ for his help. We didn't realize all those things were provided at the table because our table ran out but he took care of that & asked the other bartender to enter the order for refills. After that is when the service really went downhill. Seems that Tina was pissed that we asked someone else for assistance & verbally reprimanded the bus boy in front of us. Then we continued to sit there & be ignored for the next 20 or so minutes until the bus boy came to our aid again. At this point we simply wanted the check so we could pay & leave. We still left Tina a $6 tip for her time but it was a fraction of what the bill was. She did manage to take the time to acknowledge us on the way out with a fake smile & thanking us for coming in, but IMO it was her way of saying "FU I saw you trying to get my attention all that time & instead decided to let you wait for the bus boy again." 
Perhaps it was the fact that they were busy or understaffed but it's probably something she should have mentioned right when we sat down. I would've given a higher rating based on the quality of food, unfortunately the service can make or break an establishment & her poor customer service made it very difficult for me to give anything better than 2 stars. 
Best of luck in your endeavors - hopefully the rest of your staff is better at their jobs than Tina.

Great environment and an even greater beer selection! If you love a variety in craft brews, both local and beyond, this is your spot. If you're a gambler they have that too, plus comfy seating to watch games! I will be a regular here for sure! Cheers!

Amaziiiing food!! Never had better bar food ever! Plus the selection of beer is crazy good!!! Customer service is great as well!! Missy is so sweet and very aware of all beers on tap. Overall, best bar in Vegas by far!!

This place has really gone downhill. The service has become intolerable as this Bartender named Cat or something like that, that has an attitude that says 'I don't care who you are', I need to finish this text message, moves at her own pace and leisure. 

20 minutes to get appetizers? Yeah Right! It's not like there are 300 people ordering food and the kitchen is swamped. It's ridiculous. The last time I watched and it took close to 10 minutes just to put the order in. Are you kidding me?

Well, lets just say that our group of 20-30 friends that used to stop by for a few on our way to shows, wont be happening again!

I've heard some rumors and there is some shady sh*t going on at this place. News travels fast, specially in my circle!
Came here for the nba finals game 3, this place was totally dead and silent. Location just isn't the best, it really doesn't look much from the outside. Fair prices though.

I was expecting a normal bar burger but to my surprise it was really juicy and very tasty,...the fries are the bomb....

I will be returning very soon

*pulls up to a completely desolate strip mall parking lot -- like srsly no cars in sight*

"Uh...are you sure this is the place with 4.5 stars on yelp?? are you SURE it's 24/7??"

And yet we still ventured in to find....WE HAVE STRUCK GOLD, PEOPLE. 

24/7 bar with a KITCHEN OPEN 24/7. AND THE FOOD IS ACTUALLY GOURMET AND FRESH!? helloooooooooo new favorite place to munch out at 3AM or whatever ungodly time you feel like shamelessly eating!!

Came here on a Sunday night (heh, maybe that's why it was so empty outside) and the vibes were sooooooo chill and nice here. Like, they were playing the Glass Animals on Pandora Radio chill vibe (cuz they were literally playing Glass Animals radio). But before you think about taking your Tindr date here to get to know 'em better, be warned that it gets packed like the Marquee dance floh' when a game is on.

The menu is surprisingly impressive and modern. 

SHORT RIB POUTINE ($10) - 4.5/5 - YUM-O! I love me some fries, cheese, and meat! Their fries are really really tasty. Great amount of short rib. I'd prefer a smidge more gravy. 

MONSTER BURGER ($15) - 3.85/5 - JALAPENO BACON CREAM CHEESE?? whaaa?!? From the description it sounded like my burger soulmate - i love me some deep fried yummiez and i love me some spicy!! It's totally worth trying, but didn't taste as jizz-in-my-pants delicious as it looked. I can't even pinpoint where it went wrong, but soooomething seemed missing...personally would've preferred any other bread bun than a Hawaiian bread bun. Not a bad burger tho. Expect some grease. Paired it with sweet potato fries which were basic and on the border of looking burnt...but didn't taste burnt? See pics for reference. I'd say go with the normal fries instead.

My bae and I sat at the bar, wasted a few bucks playing video poker, sipped on $2/pint PBR's (with yelp check in), and shared a juicy burger. The server/bartender was SUCH a friendly lady and we had a good brief chat about music and alcohol. I see why they have regulars who stop by alone for a mini break from the mundane. Wouldn't wanna spend a Sunday night any other way.

TL;DR - This place is great for the convenience, vibes, and yummy food. HELLOOOOO KITCHEN OPEN 24/7!! Make me a citizen of Rebel Republic!!!

Wow ! Holy $^~£ the burger was delicious !   Arguably the best burger in Vegas. No joke.  Beer selection is amazing .  Tried a new beer and it complimented the food to a T.  Had  friendly bartender  and staff.  The  decor is classic,  defiantly a diamond in the ruff.   Can't say enough about the place other than amazing. Thank you for the excellence in thought and execution to the parties involved in bringing this . Hopefully  place sets stake and has a long life here in Vegas.

This place is probably one of my favorite bars/gastropubs in the area. Definitely has a hipster vibe with a fantastic craft beer list. Food is also very good! Have gotten southwestern egg rolls, wings, and jalapeno poppers for $6 each during their happy hour. Lots of TVs to catch sports, 1 pool table and 2 darts. They have a nice couch you can sit on in front of a TV like it's your own living room- great for small groups. 

Tucked away in a plaza w/ a patio bar. Service was good but could be more welcoming to non-regulars. Will be returning, I'm sure, nonetheless.

Wow! This place is great. I'm glad we were finally able to stop in for dinner after hearing so much about it. 

Came here on a Tuesday night, so it was pretty quiet throughout the bar, but that was totally cool with me because it gave my bf & I enough time to browse the seemingly-endless menus without pressure. (Seriously though, the beer/drink menu was huge!) 

Eventually, we decided to start with the fried pickles, along with the famous Reuben egg rolls, which were recommended to us by the kind lady behind the bar. Both were divine! I especially liked the dipping sauce that came with the egg rolls.

Two beers later, we also ordered the Eastwood burger and the Rowdy Rebel Spicy Beef Sandwich, which was definitely overdoing it because DAMN, those things were huge... and tasty! My only critique is the saltiness of the beef on the Rowdy Rebel. I was overwhelmed with the taste of soy sauce. Other than that, both were great.

We came in the other night because a friend recommended this place to me. The atmosphere is kinda cool, looks like a cool old school new school bar. It was pretty dead and it was a weekend and we got the unpleasure of being helped by a lady with short blonde hair(she didn't introduce herself  so I don't know her name) and she clearly did not want to help us. When she saw we were not locals, I think she was really annoyed but we always go to places outside of the strip and the place was dead so it's not like she had other people she was attending to. We never got a check up or a refill and she didn't write down our order and when we got our food it was wrong. If you can't remember details then pull out that trusty pen and paper.  The food was ok, have had much better burgers elsewhere.  Won't be coming back.
