Sweet little craft beer bar in Vegas. 52 beers on tap and a list of local beers. The crowd is easy going. They have plenty of tvs for your game watching pleasure and prices are good. The place smells like a bar from the 90's, beer and lots of old cigarette smoke built up. 

I'll be back for the vibe and huge beer selection.

Beer selection is great and reasonably priced.

We ordered the calamari and the rueben egg roll, both $9. The food was very flavorful, but not much for the price. It was more "bistro" trend than bar or normal restaurant servings.

Food was put down and I had to wait for silverware. My drink was empty when the food arrived and I was not offered another until the plates were cleared. The bartender did not ask how anything was and passed us multiple times. I tried to get her attention with no luck.

I might try this place again in a few months once they work a few things out. Was really looking forward to going and ended up very disappointed!

Well... I ordered the only thing on the menu not deep fat fried, I thought I would play it safe... Salad of some sort came forward, and the avocado... Listen, I love avocado.. This avocado was so flippin raw it was like rubber, it literally bent but would not break, I could not even bite into it.. uugghhhh

OK, I get it, it is a beer joint, not my choice, I was meeting some fellow UNLV students, so I went with the suggestion.. Not gonna be back, sorry..

Not a bad place for a late night food run like my friends and I needed a few weeks ago after a gig down the street. I was a little surprised that they had a Yelp coupon for a glass of beer for $0.50 and the bartender didn't know whether or not they would honor it. They checked with the manager and and they honored the coupon which was great.

The inside is smoky and although the bartenders were nice, they cursed a lot which isn't really my style when I'm a customer simply trying to order food and drink. There's a time and place, if you know what I mean.
One of the best beer bars in town.  Always an awesome, rotating selection with very knowledgeable bartenders.  Ask for Any or Syuki!

Amazing service! I rarely write my own reviews here but I cannot say enough good things about this place. Amy was such a sweetheart, such good service. The food was also so so good! Went at 9:30am, really needed a burger after a crazy Vegas night, and In-n-out was closed. I am so glad we stopped here! We had such an amazing burger, huge size patty, amazing sauces, just a great food and great service. Highly recommend!

Love their turkey burger. its clearly made in house. And lets talk about their craft beer selection..LEGIT. Kat is by far one of my favorite bartenders in Vegas, very friendly and knowledgable about her beer. I'm looking forward to October and the pumpkin beer they will tap.

I am both a beer drinker and scotch drinker and the beer selection is outstanding and they have decent scotch selections. The staff is great... Knowledgable and friendly.  The food was ON!!! I had the pork loin sandwich and tempura avocado appetizer, both extremely good. They have a bunch of TV's so every NFL game on Sunday was on... That's always a plus.  They have one pool table but have two dart boards so that was cool to throw some darts.

Overall, I really enjoyed this place and will come back again for sure for both the great food and 52 beers on tap!

Wow! This place is AUH-MAZING!!!! You have got to try the hangover burger! This is definitely not your average bar food! These burgers beat out In-N-Out! So wanna have a good time, good drinks, and some bomb food? Come here!

This place is OK, the service was good and there's TVs everywhere, so we were able to secure our own little spot for the Lakers game which was nice. 

The food is not good- standard bar food and way overpriced. The best app was the Kobe sliders, $9 for two teeny tiny sliders when you can get a real sized Kobe burger for $16 down the street. The fries were mush (both regular and sweet potatoe). 

Come for drinks? Yes. Come for food? Maybe not.
Great beer selection!  Unfortunately the food was served tepid after a long wait. I'd come back again, hoping tonight's experience was a fluke...  Cheers!

What a hidden gem!!! I came here with a group of my coworkers and it was great! They have a great happy hour for drinks and food. I ordered the chicken basket and it was really filling. The crowd is a little order. Plenty of tvs to watch sports, and they have games and plenty of seating.

So it's a slow night... Which I absolutely love! I got to talking to my bartenders and they were wonderful. Stephen was the first bartender of the night and he's a hippie rocker with the vibe of Austin which I dig. He spent extra time talking to me and helping me with my wifi. (They have free wifi) :) Guy was my second bartender... And I had reviewed his excellence at the Laundry Room. He's just awesome too. Great staff picks. I spent most of my time on my computer which is exactly what I wanted... But I was definitely not ignored! Just allowed my peace so I could work with a beer... And enjoy the great music they played. Yes, they played some EXCELLENT music tonight. Loved this place... Totally reminded me of Austin. I almost feel home again.

4 Stars mostly because I didn't eat there. We only stopped in for drinks, and really, how bad can you mess up a beer??

We ordered a few drafts and just hung out until we finished them. Our waitress, who was also the bartender was pretty awesome. She was friendly and knew a good amount about the beers they had on tap. I got a 10oz. campfire stout from highwater brewing. It was pretty amazing, I've had it in bottle, and in my opinion its way better on tap. They also had hibiscuscity on tap from stone, which is one of my absolute favorite beers by stone, so Rebel Republic gets extra brownie points for that :)

The menu looked really good, so I'm looking forward to coming back and trying there food, and hopefully giving 5 stars!

This week I am moving from Las Vegas. I want to thank both Missy and Lacey, the greatest bartenders in Vegas, hands down. The food here is amazing, the beer selection fantastic, but those two bartenders are what kept me coming back. Gonna miss you guys!

This place is great! The people are all very friendly and they welcomed us as soon as we walked in. They even bring the food to your table. One employe was wiping down the condiment area and offered to even carry my DRINKS to the table. The food was really good and the interior design is very open and inviting and absolutely spotless! I'm gonna be coming back often!

I just wish they had one in the southwest area hint hint

The person that scouts locations needs to be REPLACED ASAP because he has NO IDEA how to pick locations. If he had stopped and asked a SINGLE person in Vegas if the locations he was looking at were good spots they would've laughed in his face ! GET A CLUE MAN ! Also this isn't Florida you ACTUALLY need to ADVERTISE IN LAS VEGAS ! 

Overall an EXCELLENT concept and I hope they actually invest in a southwest location here in Las Vegas

Best sports bar in Las Vegas!

Its like watching a game in a nice living room. The place has comfortable couches and an abundance of seats. TV's are everywhere! One of the great things they do, that some sports bars do not....the play the games with the sound on!

Excellent food and they have a huge beer selection. The waitresses are always fantastic too. The place is never overly packed, I've always been able to get a seat. Just the perfect place for a game.

Great restaurant/bar off the strip!! We needed some hangover food and energy before driving back to southern California and this was the perfect option. The Hangover burger was huge and they had some of the best onion rings I've ever had (but the regular fries and sweet potato fries were delicious as well). My friend had the Spicy Chicken sandwich and she loved it. The fish tacos were crispy, not over breaded and fresh! I got the Shroom burger and they were super accommodating since I can't have dairy. Got it without cheese, but with avocado and on a wheat bun. Fun selection of drinks and food and seems like everything is a good option.

 I'll definitely keep this in my top places to visit when in Vegas. The service was impeccable. Our waitress, Amy, was extremely sweet, friendly, and personable. She made sure we were taken care of! Check this place out!
Found this place thanks to yelp, all I can say is this place is a hidden gem! Service was awesome and friendly! Food was amazing, had the Kobe sliders and the calamari! Will definitely be returning!

I don't see what all the hype is about. Feels like redneck chic interior, with a hipster attitude for beer and a quasi-Asian (very limited) food menu. Sorry but there are much better places around town deserving of my hard earned bucks.

I live not too far from the world famous Sahara/Valley View intersection. Surrounded by old secret skate spots, the long standing Terribles Car wash, Villa Pizza, and a shop with a sign that just reads KNIVES.  
  Through the many years I've always had noticed a bar called the Bounty Hunter tucked far in the north eastern corner of the parking lot. I had always believed it to be closed, at least Until recently, I had no idea it was renovated and now called Rebel Republic.  
    Well, through the 2 channels I get my information from I figured what the hell. It's close, it's not a dotties or any other "mini casino", and they allegedly had 40+ beers on tap.
   My interest was piqued and I hit up their happy hour!


         With plenty of parking available I was able get a prime spot within 50-100'. As I approached I noticed a lovely out door Bench area with fantastically green faux grass(awesome) and a bean bag horseshoe thing game. 
 I was here for the beer, so I just b-lined for the bar. 
    I was greeted with a smile by the Beautiful Missy, The bartender who's shift had just started, and the lovely young lady with glasses who was getting ready to leave. 
 As I sat down my eyes panned across the taps and said to myself, "that's not even 25 taps behind the bar!"  
  My inner voice was actually speaking out loud at that point, and I was surprisingly impressed as my attention was directed to the other set of taps on the opposite side of the bar. At that moment I found myself surrounded by 52 delicious, craft beers. This was my Willy Wonkas Factory. 

     I found Missy very, very helpful pairing my flavour ideas with the beers on tap.  
   I started off with a Brooklyn Summer Ale, followed by the brew Purple Haze, switched up to a few Stone Ruination IPAs and then finished off with another Purple Haze and BSAle. 
     During my stint in the pub an unexpected business/office looking party of around 20/25 rolled in all at once. 
  The young lady who had just worked a double, got back on shift and the two lovely bartends handled business like stRaight up bosses. 
     After a few drinks, I tried some appetizers. BBQ pork sliders and BBQ pork egg rolls. I found them on the spicy side, but that's coming from someone who would get a negative 22 on Thai food. 
    The food was good, but not great. Of course That was just 2 happy hour appetizers. 
      Looking around I noticed their logo resembles a Pabst label, Which in my opinion is the equivalent of a hipster bat signal, and for a moment I second guessed myself being there. 
    However I hold no judgement whilst drunken. 
    I have found a 100% real, local, neighborhood bar with the best beers in the area on tap and bottle, food, great service, and an atmosphere that is becoming a rarity in this city.   
  Looking forward to my third visit and many more.

  I heard they have a beer club and I'm off to a great start.
  The juke box seals the deal

Came in for the happy hour and enjoyed their sliders, reuben rolls and caprese salad. There was no servers for us then, so we had to go up and order from the bar from our table. The reuben spring roll was a deep fried bomb of gooey crispy enjoyment. Caprese salad was sliced thick with tomatoes and mozz cheese. Their sliders were like a breaded round ball of ground meat with a teri-bbq sauce drizzled over it. 

Go for the Mammoth beer selections. Impressive beer on tap offerings. Also, special bottled beers with special prices are available. Ciders, sours, IPA & everything in between is available. Something for everyone.

If u r not a regular. Don't bother unless u r not in any kind of hurry to get service. The beer list is very nice and the prices r awesome. Too bad for the awful service. Also a very smokey room. No air filters to c anywhere.

Occasionally, I like to venture out of the strip to visit a local gem. The Rebel Republic seems to be a local favorite so I thought why not give it a try. Judging the establishment from the outside it seems like a local dive bar. Right when you walk in to Rebel Republic you are welcomed with a fresh cigarette scent. It must the new air freshener "La Menthol." The scent is very strong so I warn you to enter with caution. 

Also, don't stand by the door looking silly just go ahead and seat yourself. The servers are not very attentive so you might have to flag them down to get you menus and drinks. Patience is a must at this restaurant because it took about 40 minutes for them to deliver the food. It took them so long that the bartender offered us another drink on the house. I appreciate that the bartender was trying to make it right. Therefore, I added another star to the rating otherwise they would've gotten the "Meh, I've experienced better." I mean how long does it take to make nachos and other finger food? 

When the food did finally arrived it was quite good. I recommend the Reuben Egg Rolls and Avocado Tempura. Both of those were excellent. The sauces on both of those items were very good. The nachos is another good selection. It comes loaded with chicken, avocado, sour cream, pico de gallo and a bed of melted nacho cheese. It was good but not 40 minutes of waiting good. 

I would like to give Rebel Republic a higher score but first they need to work on being more efficient and put a pep in their steps. Second, the cigarette smell can be unbearable for some. My buddy was choking up the entire time he was there.
My friends got the burgers which they loved, and I got the fish tacos! Surprisingly good, also the onion rings are a MUST

This independent craft beer bar is one of my favorite hang outs. Ambiance is relaxed and casual and refreshingly independent. This great neighborhood bar is a reminder that we should never have to settle for another PTs! Good food and great bars and extremely comfortable seating.

Great selection of beer and alcohol. NFL package on deck. Great eats.. Oh, and if you like to degen, they have video gaming. Even better, a system to play your own music and listen to your own TV that your game is on. Getting it right. Support

Ok...you should read my first review. I fell I love with this place the first time I stepped in it. I love the atmosphere, the food and the huge beer selection. 
However....I had a huge party here...I brought over 30 people, and the staff ignored us most of the time. It was so offensive, that I being that many people (yes, it was coordinated), which means income, and ignore the guests half the time. They were nice when they talked to you, but getting them to talk to you was almost impossible. 
I was so disappointed, I just couldn't even come on here and give this place a bad rating. 
Well, I stopped in to meet a friend, and met an actual nice bartender.  Her name is Sachi,  and she was friendly and soooo helpful. She made a point to come talk to me about UFC fights they will be showing soon, and brought me some water without asking. 
Love a bartender that anticipates your needs!  The only problem is she only works days until 4pm. I wish all the bartenders were this attentive. 
Either way, I have new hope in this bar!
I'll be back to try again.

Honestly I drive down Sahara all the time and have never noticed this place existed until we came here after a work retreat for their happy hour. Inside its super chill with a couple pool tables, bikes on the ceiling and a very sporty yet trendy vibe.

Drink wise they have tons of beer. I'm talking two full pages of beers and ciders. There's something here for any type of beer lover and also a full bar for other drinks too. 

They also had some pretty decent food specials. We tried the wings, southwest egg rolls, pastrami egg rolls, and fried Kobe sliders. My personal favorite was the pastrami egg rolls. It's nothing like I've ever had before and very tasty. It was sort of like a ruben sandwich with a twist. I'd have to say the wings and southwest egg rolls were just so so, but enjoyed the sliders. Overall B+ for bar food. 

I'd recommend checking this place out for a good happy hour bite and drink. I'd like to see why the crowds like on a weekend too.

What's good: I brought my friends from out of town to Rebel Republic to avoid the strip, enjoy a game and have a good meal and drinks. We were not dissapointed. There was seating for 8 of us and plenty of beer selection to go with bar food i.e. sliders, jalapeño poppers, and burgers. The prices were reasonable and I would return.           
 
Opportunity: For some reason there was no Blue Moon which was odd to me. They took our drink orders as soon as we sat but it took 30 minutes for the waitress to return to our table to place the food order. When our food was ready they brought only 4 orders and it took another 10 minutes or so for the other 4 orders to be ready. I really hope that perhaps a staff member called out because it's actually a good place to come back to and not have the bad experience.

Great bar! Great food! A little off the strip bar that is the perfect place to have a beer, play some pool and catch up with my nephew who lives in the area. We will definitely be back. Best sliders in L.V.

This place sux I ordered 4 cocktails that were on the drink menu and they were out of ingredients to make them I couldn't believe it are you kidding me then take them off the menu if you can't supply the ingredients for them I wanted to leave but hubby already ordered a beer so I settled on a shot of Patron at least they weren't out of that and after going around and around with the drinks hell I needed the shot

I have been to Rebel Republic a few times and found the staff to be okay, they often leave you unattended for long periods of time.  I also noticed they would run out of food from the already limited menu.  Overall not impressed with this location
Great selection of beer, love the atmosphere. They have pool, darts and nice lounge area to relax. And the hangover burger is awesome.

Friendly owner and bartender. Great selection of craft beer on tap. I've only had the burger and fries but it was delicious.  They in smoked pork with the beef to make the patties. The smoke flavor is really prevalent. They also have a beer club. $25 for the year and you get a personalized mug and a beer of the week each week. Atmosphere is great. A lot of TVs so this would be a great place to catch the games. I would definitely recommend.

So... rebel republic happened. Again. I gave it another try and to my dismay the service was still just awful. They've got a great selection of beers, great happy hour prices, their food is good and the atmosphere is just right. Comfy booths, not too loud but still a great bar. But I'm sorry every time we've gone, the bartenders are way too busy taking shots with their friends or just flat out ignoring you to take your order. It's not like it was super busy, when that's the case I have so much more patience. But when you are just plain avoiding the side of the bar with all the customers and taking shots with your friends while you're behind the bar... it just doesn't give a good impression. Or make someone want to go back. 
  I think I'll have to decline the next time this place is suggested for a happy hour get together.

Update:  so sad to see my fave bartender Wendy is no longer @ RR... Bummer, I liked that place ... 
Hopefully I'll find her at a new spot!!

I was looking for a good spot for NFL.. With good food, atmosphere and specials...

There are the good dingy neighborhood hangs where you feel at home but you may not want to share that place with friends or a potential date..

Rebel Republic is the dive bar vibe you want minus the crappy food, dirty draft beer.. Loud fans and crappy dry wings..

It's comfortable no matter where you are from-  the happy hour/NFL game and specials are great because the food is actually good..

Everything fresh.. Nothing frozen..

Tons of TVs and a very eclectic crowd..
Sports fans, rock n rollers, blue & white collars and a couple of gay couples..

That says a lot about a place to me.. Everyone is welcome and everyone wants to be there..

Wendy & Tina are great as is the kitchen staff and bar backs.. Food is served hot fresh and quick..

Hot tips-  try the 5$ happy hour NFL food menu:  Avocado Tempura served w a great sauce & chop sticks 

And the Mini Sliders are AMAZING 

I have yet to do the bottomless sat / sun Mimosas & Bloodys..


Highly recommended

My friend I stopped in one very early morning because I was craving a beer and a burger. Well, the small plates are to die for. The beer selection is varied and wonderful and ummm hello deep friend twinkies!!

Larry is a wonderful bartender!

The big news here is the beer selection: 52 beers on draft!  Rebel Republic is one of the newer gastropub/sports bars in town, which I hope is a trend that continues.  Why shouldn't you be able to enjoy good food with good drink?

Three of us stopped by on a Thursday night, and the bar was pretty empty even though there were games on; I'm assuming it's because they're pretty new.  The bar uses a lot of wood and piping for a neat industrial design.  Plenty of seating and plenty of TV's, I doubt there's a bad seat here.  They have a pool table and two dart boards.  The dart area is set up nicely, and offers a bit of privacy, however the throwing line (oche, if you want to use the correct term) is about a foot too close to the dart board.

Between us we shared a bunch of appetizers and a burger.  The sliders were good, and interestingly the patty was deep fried.  We tried a pork special they had, which had an Asian inspired sauce; decent.  Wings were good, nice and big, not too much breading.  The tempura avocado was forgettable.  The Pastrami Eggroll was good, and reminded me of a reuben pasty from Cornish Pasty, except more cylindrical.  The burger was a big miss; the beef quality was not there, it was flavorless, and all you tasted was bread and sauce.  

Not a bad place, lots of food and drink specials during games.  For the 6 dishes and 7 beers we ordered during Thursday Night Football, it came out to $30 per person including tip; not too bad.  Definitely a spot to keep in mind if you're in the area.

Missy is the shiiiiiit!! Have her as your waitress/bartender every night. She's the real MVP. 
This woman should birth my unborn children and yours too. If you don't like her, then I don't like you. 

Say it with me, "Missy! Missy! Missy!"

Heard about this place from a friend. Came here on a Monday late night. It's a hidden gem off Sahara if you blink you'll miss it. Really nice atmosphere 

The beer list is insane! If your a craft beer fan then you'll be In love ( coors, bud people need not apply) lol

I ordered the Kobe sliders and they were restaurant quality. Didn't taste like bar food at all, I'm coming back for the sliders ! 

Finally our bartender Phil was amazing.

First time visiting this place and we really liked it! The food was good, the atmosphere was fun... Except the weird decor... It needs some updating, felt like I was in some hunting lodge. 

TVs are nice, a lot of them, good size! 

We were there for the NBA finals... It was busy, not crazy though, there was only person working... The bartender... But she was pretty bad ass and handled it really well. She checked in on us a lot and really impressed me with how she was handling it all. 


We really liked it and will be back for sure.

Went there for happy hour. What a waste. The food was small $6 for 3 chicken strips that were slathered i  oil. The beer was supposed to be happy hour but full price was charged. This place is nothing special.

It's a good find.  The food is good,  especially for pub food. The selection of premium beers is great. Full bar too. The prices on food are a little bit high, but keep in mind this place is close to the Strip, and all prices increase as you hit the center of Vegas.
The Ruben egg roll and calamari appetizers were really tasty and unique, just smaller portions than expected.
We had wings, mushroom burger and spicy chicken sandwich -- all good, better than most bars and pubs.
The regular fries are well seasoned, not just salt - very tasty.
I recommend the onion rings as your side, they are the tempura batter style - my favorite.
The service was great.
I will be going back.
Nice atmosphere, great beer selection, and cool layout for gathering with friends. Video poker pay tables are decent and good size crowd for a Friday night bar in a strip plaza.

The couple times I've went was for my friend's birthday and bachelor party. 

Happy hour food was unexpectedly great! Most bar food I've had was always greasy and no flavor, but not here! 

Not a beer drinker myself but with their craft beer I will always be able to find something that suits my taste buds! Will definitely come back!

This is our Go-To bar now. The food is BIG so we usually share. I recommend the Hangover Burger, just try it. The Tempura Avocado is good, too.
Oddly every time we go in it's the EXACT same people sitting in the same seats. I mean, like, 5 times now.
 The loss of one star is having to wait 20-30 minutes for the check, even after asking for it.

This place is a hit on game day....thanks Yelp....they have pretty sweet happy hour specials during the game and surprisingly the food is really good. This place is certainly a dive bar by all means tho, however the locals make you feel more than welcome with their jokes and laughter minus the fact that they were all hard core Raider fans. Service was quick and easy and let's not mention they had every tv perfectly tuned to the nfl game so that the left side of the bar doesn't ruin the next play before the right side views it. Go for the wings, the bbq sliders, or the jalapeño poppers....all above average bar food specials.....although the redskins lost, I had plenty of $2 PBRs and $5 wings to drown my sorrows....

This place was so good!! Tried a few things and everything was excellent. If you like burgers then try the Hangover burger. Everyone is so nice and chill and unlike the strip it was not over priced. So if you want to try something different then this is a great place.

Last Monday night was my third and last time visiting this establishment. Great selection of beer. First visit 18 months ago was great. Service the last two visits was horrific. Second visit 6 months ago we brought a group of 14 in at midnight and called them in advance to let them know. The cook didn't show so the bartender and bar back (who apparently was thrown into the kitchen) were the only two people there. The food was horrible and service was slow, despite there being very few people outside of our group there. Wrote it off to bad luck and gave them another shot last night (Tuesday). We (wife and I) walked in at 7:02 PM and stood at the bar with two friends who had arrived earlier. We stood there for 30 minutes without being served. The two bartenders never even looked in our direction and rarely came down to our end of the bar. After waving my arms and jumping up and down, one of them finally came over and, when we explained we had been there for 30 minutes, she asked "so why did you stay"? Interesting business model. Her excuse was that there was a group of 80 that had walked in without calling ahead. I've tended bar before and if I had moved as slow as they were, chatting with other customers while people walked in and stood there for 30 minutes without being served, I would have been fired. I won't be back. Aces and Ales has a better beer selection and is run professionally.

First time here tonight and I'll definitely be back. We sat at the bar. Kat was awesome. Very friendly once we stepped foot into the door. We asked for food recommendations and I decided on the Philly cheesesteak with onion rings. Probably the BEST Philly I've ever had and the fresh onion rings were amazing. My friend ordered the bbq burger which was delicious as well. The buns were so fresh and soft. I was very happy with the food. Kat took very good care of us and all the other customers were satisfied too. Everyone was happy : ) big thank you to Kat!!!

Awesome beer selection Awesome food been going here for a while went in the other day they had expired beer in bottles no bottle or beer selections on the chalk board & really getting rid of exquisite beers for beers you can find anywhere "campfire stout" who's decision was this ?? this really turns this once fabulous beer bar into a dive bar use to go out of my way to take friends and myself to enjoy a great selection but why now if they only have mediocre beer on tap & the expired beer tops the cake. Management pay attention !!! this what brings in customers good beer good selection & fresh items not old expired beer.
Really nice bar with a awesome beer selection. Lots of TVs to watch every game. I didn't have food but my girlfriend said the wings were excellent. I'll be back.

Amazing! Almost my home away from home. Great staff slinging the best drinks and grub. Try the rebel burger! Great atmosphere and love to watch football here. They have like 22 Tvs!!!!

Oh and they have 52 beers on tap! What! It's like beer heaven. Run don't walk to this place.

I love this bar! 
Great service  and food. Large screen  tv. And lots of them. All kinds of beer. This place is so cool.

For my sisters and I, this place has been a god send. Local pub that's tucked in the back of an old plaza. I grew up around here and adore that locals have a place to go for quality craft beer and food that isn't on the damn strip. 

For that one guy that complains about someone smoking. Dude it's a bar, there is going to be smoke. If you don't like it, why the f*ck did you decide to go eat a bar?!

On that note, the food is the shiz. Taco Tuesday, great happy hour and they have cheese curds!!!

My wife and I were referred here by some bar buddies.  We came and loved it.  Made it for the happy hour and had the amazing reuben egg rolls, Kobe sliders, chic wings and some jalapeño poppers.  Loved the food and the awesome beer selection.  The service is great and they have a good selection for gaming machines.  Very cool.  We will be back!!!

A bunch of friends came out on Saturday night for karaoke.  Our favorite karaoke company (Karate Karaoke) started here this past Saturday night, and we wanted to support them! 

What a cute place!  Its open, spacious, clean, bright (for a pub). 

All of the bar staff were friendly and helpful.  Drinks aren't super expensive here, unlike so many other spots.  

One of our friends got a burger that I had to try:  YUM.  Quality food!

They have signs up advertising for $2 tacos, tequila and Dos Equis on Tuesdays, so I'm definitely going to be coming back for that.  

There is one pool table, and a couple of dart boards in the back.  I can definitely see this pub becoming a regular hangout for me and my friends.  

Karaoke was awesome!  Volume was great.  With the bar being as open as it is, it works out really well for karaoke:  the music can be up loud for the singers, and it really doesn't affect most of the gamblers sitting at the bar.  

I can't wait to come back!
Seriously... My fav local bar in the area... great food, amazing rotating beer selection and awesome service... Be sure to order the "Larry, Sweet Larry" shot... You will not be disappointed.
Great place! Huge beer list, great decor. Weird location, but screw it! Come in and drink!

I like to take small adventures around the city and try out new locations especially during football season.  We've heard a lot about the Rebel Republic and decided to try it out.  Judging the establishment from the outside it seems like a local dive bar. Right when you walk in to Rebel Republic you are welcomed with a cigarette scent.  The place was empty and their was plenty of open seating.  The waiter was nice and friendly and she took our order promptly.  The food was okay, nothing special but based upon our sole purpose of coming here to watch the football game, it was a miss.

Great place. 

Came here for a late Sunday Breakfast. Had their steak and eggs and two beers

Plenty of seating, tons of TV's (which the bartender was happy to change to what ever you wanted to watch)

HUGE beer list with pretty reasonable prices (when a tap is about to kick the price goes down to 3 bucks a pour)

Food was great. Huge hamburgers, and awesome onion rings.

Ill revisit every time I'm in Vegas.

This bar is fucking killer. Draft selection is amazing, bartenders are rad. 

I have yet to try the food but the bar has a really amazing vibe that you can't find in Vegas.

Awesome.
Rebel burger was amazing and made to order! We ate there twice and food wasn't made the same but still delicious. Highly recommend the onion rings

Great place to just kick back and enjoy great brews. The severs and bartenders are super chill. For a bar that just opened like 6 weeks ago, they operate like they have been there for a long time. They definitely know what they are doing and suprisingly knowledgeable about the brews they carry. Owner is super friendly. Overall amazing bar. Be back for some food on my next visit soon!

This bar is a hidden gem... Somewhere to definitely meet up for a quick bite and to watch sporting events. I am very happy to have found this place. Amazing service that can deliver knowledge on the quality of beer and food selection. Phil the bartender is my fave.. He always recommends the best beers on draft.

I am visiting my friend, coworker & bartender, Carla,at this awesome new sports bar. This place is big, beautiful & welcoming. The food is fusion deliciousness. They have this pool tables, gaming, a gazillion gynormous big screen tv's  a great juke box & a covered patio that literally beckons you to hang out & have a PDA.
Try the variety of egg rolls. They avocado for vegans & reuben, for the not. Ask for a side of their tangy pickle juice. It tastes so good, you will want to lick it off of ANYTHING (yes, I mean anything).

So we go here alot and love the food, atmosphere, wide variety of beers, and great customer service and bartender interactions.  Literally come for the burgers and great beers, despite being quite a hike from our house.  

However today , Oct 11th Tuesday 4:32 am. Me and my wife just got off of work and she was craving thier famous burgers and Philly reuben eggrolls.  Bar is 24/7 and they have installed a RING doorbell, well we rang and rang the bell and called the posted number incase the doorbell isn't answered.  Lights were on and the music was blasting out in their front porch seating area, after 10 minutes or so of doorbell, knocking and calling with no reply, we left to go find something else.

Either no one can here us banging on the door, or the doorbell video isn't working and the phone is on silent or the staff was taking a siesta, it was a waste of our our time and a drive and we were just getting more tired from post work fatigue.

Any other time 5 stars on food and drinks and service but going to a 24/7 bar with music playing and it's obviously open but someone deems our patronage not important enough to even answer, well kinda ruined our excited burger craving vibe.

Don't get me wrong I will keep coming back but tonite it just sucked.

This is one of those places you see, but might accidentally dismiss as a dive. It really isn't. The food is great, the beer is fantastic, and the service is stellar.

The beer selection is at a higher level. Think Aces 'n' Ales, but with a more personal experience. There are over 50 different ways to have a great time at Rebel Republic (RR). Do you enjoy great beer? Do you enjoy being served by people who also enjoy great beer? 

If you're looking for a place to drink some great beer and experience some great service, go to Rebel Republic.

As far as my personal experience goes, the bartender Larry knew his shit. He had no problem with providing me samples for the beers I had never tasted.

Seriously. Go there and drink dat good beer.
I go cause Chelesa is a babe and super attentive and I love her.   Bar is totally not Smokey and I loveeeee that!  Damn good Bloody Mary's :)!

I like coming to RR - I'm usually here once a week or every other week as I'm part of their beer club ($25 bucks a year for one free beer a week in your own mug - can't beat that!) 52 beers on tap with changes pretty regularly. I love the vibe in here with the decor and pool tables, darts, etc. plenty of big televisions to enjoy multiple sports. They've expanded their food menu so there are more options now. There are only two reasons why I can't give them 5 stars: 1). They don't have pizza (what is a sports bar without pizza?) 2). The service can be pretty slow at times. Seems like their POS system may have issues as a lot of the staff spends a great deal of time there. I'd recommend checking it out but you have to sit at the bar if you want decent service since there are no servers, just bartenders.

A friend and I were looking for a bar to watch football on Sunday. We luckily found Rebel Republic! My first thought driving up was that it was closed, false! The bar is spacious and there wasn't too many people there. We enjoyed this as we never waited long for service. We both got to watch our game at the bar. 

I ordered the breakfast burrito with fried chicken instead of the pork. Yum! I didn't think I would be able to eat the whole burrito,  but I did! So delicious! 

We really enjoyed Kate, the bartender, and will be going back next Sunday for the same experience.

Good service, outstanding beer selection, and delicious food.

I was not expecting this place to be anything more than mediocre, man was I wrong. We started off with the avocado tempura which were delicious. Very fresh avocado and the chili lime sauce gave them a nice little kick. For entrees I ordered the prime rib philly cheesesteak the meat was so tender with just the right amount of bell peppers and cheese. I would definitely order it again.  My girlfriend ordered the turkey club which she says that was the best turkey club shes had EVER! 
As for drinks I ordered a simple yet refreshing Pear cider, while she ordered a black velvet both were very good. Overall we will definitely be returning!

I've been coming to Rebel Republic a few times a month ever since they opened. The food has always been very, very good and consistent, and I love the revolving beer selections and how they have a "locally brewed" section on their beer menu. The atmosphere/music/decor is great too... a little bit of "hipster" in an part of town that needs it! 

That being said, I have one major issue that has been bugging the hell out of me for the past year... and I'm not one to review stuff on Yelp, but by doing this I hope this problem will get some attention: Rebel Republic, YOU NEED A WAITER OR WAITRESS TO COVER THE FOOD AND DRINK ORDERS AT THE TABLES. Your bartenders are nice and cool, but thanks to them running orders out to the high-tops, we patrons at the bar go dry and get ignored. I've been at the bar on late swing on a weekday, and there's two bartenders and someone who appears to be a bar-back, but still, everyone is too busy servicing the tables. You realize that some parties with 6-8 people all want separate checks and when it's time for them to leave, the bartenders are spending 10 minutes with their nose in the register closing out tabs? I've seen it happen there quite often... while I'm sitting there with an empty beer for 8-10 minutes. Ask your bartenders about this... they know it's true, but I suspect they want the extra money/tips from the food orders... but really, I think if they just had to focus on the bar-top clients and rely on a waitstaff to deal with the tables, the bartender's tips will be better just based on the better service... I know I would tip better! 

Bartenders need to constantly be aware of what's going on around them... they need to look around, check on everyone at the bar and make eye contact with them. Rebel mostly fails at this. 

PT's bartenders are trained to hit a customer up for another drink when they see the client's drink down to about 20%. They also, upon taking a food order at the bar, immediately put the tray with all the amenities in front of the customer. I can't tell you how many times I've ordered food at Rebel and the cook (cool guy too) brings it out and then I'm waiting to get the bartenders attention so I can get flatware, napkins, S&P, ketchup etc... oh, and another beer. 

I'm not a huge fan of PT's Pubs, but I suggest Rebel adopt the above two practices because if you make the above two things a rule, you'll already be running things more efficiently and the bartenders will save time and hassle just by doing these two pro-active things that are merely anticipatory and common sense. 

Maybe try just letting the bartenders handle the food ordered by people at the bar, and have a waiter/waitress do the table orders. I recently saw a sign on the tables saying "You're welcome to sit here (at a high top) but see the bartender for your drink/food order." I can appreciate this on Graveyard, but not at other times... you have enough table business to justify a waitstaff and by doing this, your bartenders will hopefully connect better with the bar patrons (and schmooze the gamers!) and they'll return more often. Right now all your bartenders are just robot serving machines, constantly trying to stay caught up when it's even the slightest bit busy... and it's not working.

Over the past 6-8 months I've noticed increased business there... more bodies in the place, people enjoying themselves... and I'm happy for you but it's making this service issue worse, not better.

So there it is folks. Again, I love this bar... I live in the neighborhood and want this place to succeed... but I'm about done waiting around for decent service.

We checked out this place with a few of our colleagues after training. It's probably our new go to place after hours. Good music, great happy hour menu and drinks!! We ordered the tacos and wings. Unfortunately,
I wasn't able to eat the tacos because they marinate it with pineapple juice and chunks of pineapple. Same with the BBQ sauce on the chicken wings (chipotle one too)! The reason for the 3 stars is because the cook in the back came out with it and was kinda rude. Maybe it was a bad night for him? I always end up changing my reviews as things get better. Anyways! We ordered the wings naked with the sauce on the side. It came out sauced up. Still kept it and my hubs ate it. The bartender/ server was super nice. He came back to check up on us and knew our order was wrong so he came back with a side of wings for me. His customer service was great. His food recommendations were on point. There are tv's all around. Lots of seating for groups and just that bar experience you really want to enjoy with people. Can't wait to go back for those wings! Juicy and plump! It's more like drumsticks because we didn't get one wing at all lol. It's okay! It was delicious! Happy eating my fellow Yelpers!

Kobe sliders are a little bit of heaven! They are a must try! The fries were also delicious. They just started "silver screen Sunday." They show a movie at the bar on Sunday. It was Super Troopers this week. Great craft beer selection on tap

Decided to finally drop in here to watch the Ravens v Patriots game. Its been on my bookmarks for awhile due to the 56 beers on tap.

When I rolled in, there were only two tables being served, and just a couple people at the bar, gambling. Its a big space, with a large central bar with gaming, and table tops all around the perimeter. Plenty of TV's for your viewing pleasure. 

The beer selection is very good, I sampled a couple hefeweizens I had never tried before, and a Belgian White. All were very good. I also went for the football game special pulled pork sliders ($6). Very tasty with a fried pickle on top. A bit spicy for my palette, but I'm a spice wimp so I would suspect many would enjoy them. They had a number of quality selections for their bar food, so that means several return trips are forthcoming.

Very good service by the girls. The place slowly filled up throughout the game, and I overheard many great comments about the food from other tables.
Great food, great bartenders, great selection in beer!! A must go too!! Kat is a great bartender very social and great on helping with beer selections!!
Missy is the best bartender! Very attentive, amazingly personable and an all around fabulous bartender! She made our night. We will be back again to see her! I highly recommend you come see her.

Awesome food! We love the egg rolls, and the wings with the rebel sauce. Larry was great! He gave us really good recommendations for beers since there are so many ( 52 beers on n tap) we will definitely be back :)

I'm part of their excellent Rebel Beer Club. I've been coming every week for 23 straight weeks. The service is amazing. Sachi and Kat are awesome, very attentive, and will engage you in conversation. I plan all my get-togethers with friends at this place including movie nights, my birthday, and our fantasy football draft. The draft beers change weekly and are always on top of what is fresh and new. Plus, the food is delicious and very different!
Ruben egg rolls and short rib potine, I  don't need to say enything more.  Oh wait I do; beer, good beer, great beer, lots and lots of beer.

Wow.  Amy was amazing and had great recommendations for craft beer.  Their selection had a few rare beers that you can't find anywhere.  Bourbon county stout, velvet merkin and worldwide stout... amazing.  Definitely a must visit location.

First time,surely not last. The Mother Earth Brewing Co . beer was great. So smooth.  Had the shroom burger. Very good with a hint of smoked meat.  Big couches and a bar with a lot of drafts.  Gonna need to keep coming back until I make it through the whole menu.

Favorite new bar spot for us. Atmosphere and staff is great. Customer service is awesome. Food is pretty good bar food. Great selections of beers. Great place to watch the games. 
Its near by my house so thats awesome!

Great selection of beer. The one star was for the selection of beer,  because the service was awful. I am a bartender in town at another establishment so I want to start off by saying I'm not perfect and I have bad days. So I'll give people the reasonable doubt that they might be having a bad day when the service sucks. 

Service, however, is pretty awful consistently around this time. Girl behind the bar was eating food (gross) BEHIND THE BAR, and then she was on her phone. Now I said before that I'll give anyone a bad day as an excuse but I've been here before seeing as how I live around the corner. Because I've been here before a number of times and she has yet to even approach me to ask me if I need something to drink, I'm sure it's safe to say she's either always having a bad day or she just doesn't care. So the service with her apparently is always terrible in my experience, but I've noticed if you're a guy you might have better luck with getting a drink from her. I don't know her name because she's never helped me out, but she has long straight hair every time I come colored brown and blondeish

The other girl was Missy and even though I feel bad for calling out her name on Yelp I asked her for a Coors light and she never brought it,  which made things worse. The third girl who was there was the one who got me the Coors light as soon as I ordered it with short blonde hair. It appeared as though maybe she was the manager or owner. 

When I first sat down I had met my boyfriend who was waiting for me and he was with his friend earlier at this bar. I sat down and maybe five to ten minutes later (which felt like 20) I was finally greeted. Before I was greeted I jokingly said to my bf "i would love a drink"  and he responded "yea,  it took forever before I was greeted too." 

Grave shift is the best time to come here because that's when you actually get served drinks without begging. 

Obviously, this is a long review and most people won't read it but I wrote this review mostly to help out management. If they had been busy I would have been forgiving, but eating behind the bar and being on your phone is straight negligence. Great potential but wrong crew to carry it out. 

I can go to ANY bar to get a drink, it's the service at a bar that makes it worthwhile.

It's been a few weeks since I've been here with my friends so this review will be about what stuck with me in that time frame.

First, when we went in it still had that new bar smell, meaning it hasn't been inundated with the smell of smoke infused furniture yet. There were screens eveer.erywhere and the amount of beers on tap was reminiscent of a Yard House selection (woohoo!) They had some awesome happy hour deals and this huge "rebel mug" that was about the size of my head. We sat around for a while on some couches contemplating the extensive beer menu. We purchased our drinks at the bar and were about to play some billiards when, rounding the corner, I spotted the best thing I have seen in a bar ever (besides beer). 

There is a small cubby dedicated to playing darts! Two adjacent dartboards with a little table for drinks. Our group invaded this area and held it for hours, playing the dumbest games. We enjoyed strange music being chosen by a group on the far end of the bar via jukebox (kinda expensive) and drank maybe 2-3 beers each. One of the staffers (an owner perhaps) came by and took our picture as we played. It was a fun and good ol time, and it was all for ourselves.

I haven't had the chance to sample food but the drinks were great. There was an excellent selection of craft beers on tap (gulden draak, one of my favorites, being one)

My only reason for the 4star review is because there is still room for improvement. We weren't served as promptly as I thought we would be considering it was a new establishment and building rapport with new clientele should be priority. Also, I wasn't returned my driver's licence (which I had to forfeit in exchange for the darts) when we were done playing although I had asked. Communication amongst staff seemed lacking, though understandable because the team was so new. I was inconvenienced of making a shocking discovery within the next two days that my ID was missing and would have to drive back to retrieve it. Upon returning though, I was taken care of by Missy, a cheerful bartender who really helped me settle in as I enjoyed a beer.

Would definitely come again!

(I apologize for lack of content and criticism in my reviews, still learning how to write!)

The 2 stars is for the beer selection. It's pretty dang good. 0 stars for attentiveness and service. Also we came here to watch the Rebels game and thy didn't even have it on the tv. They were confused when we asked them to change the channel... "What game are you looking for?" Umm, the Rebel game that is being nationally televised. They put it on, but there was no sound. Very disappointing for a place that praises the Rebels. Wish I would want to come back for the beer selection, but I really don't want to. :/

Love it! Love it! Love it! The food is great and not expensive! The bartenders friendly and quick!! Their chicken wings are to die for!!! We will be back!! Even though it's a bar, it's not smoky at all!  What a pleasant surprise!! I can't wait to be back!
Great escape from the strip for sports.  Great beer list.  Good TVs.  Good food.  It's a real bar.

This is a cool neighborhood bar to visit after work. My company had our happy hour here recently and the food along with the drinks were delish. The bartenders were super friendly and kept our drinks full. There's darts, pool, big screen tv's, couches and a juke box. That's a big win for me since I love those things. I'll probably frequent this place a little more since I know its there.

Seriously delicious (and huge) burgers. The hangover burger was the best fried egg burger I've tasted to date. The fries are definitely hand cut and super tasty. We also had the mushroom burger and it was spot on. They have an extensive beer list with so many great choices. The only downside was that it was smoky, but this is Vegas, so it is what it is!

This place is the best beer bar in town. Their prices are outstanding and their selection is top notch. When you walk in, the staffs' Certified Beer Server certificates are displayed, which means they know what they're doing.

The food is excellent and fairly priced and the customer service is awesome (Shout out to Phil, the bartender.)

I will be back, as I have high expectations and they definitely delivered.

First time at this bar on Tuesday and I can tell you that I will already be back! When you immediately walk in you feel welcomed and it's so spacious. You almost don't know where to sit lol the great happy hour menu is the main thing I am coming back for. Although I didn't get to try it since I was there at 6, I was in time for Taco Tuesday. $2 modelos! Happy Hour 2-6pm Late Night 1-5am
